At the party, the other dentist notes that Lorne-- going by another name and sporting a new, all grey, much more flattering haircut-- would get along well with his brother. It turns out his brother is in witness protection but the other dentist says to hell with it and will introduce Lorne to him on a trip next week to Las Vegas.

Which brings us to the moment that Lester saw him in Vegas. He approaches Lorne at the table. Lorne pretends not to know him but Lester presses the issue. Lorne and his party finally get up to go-- and Lorne says to him "walk away"-- but Lester can't let it go and tracks them to the elevator. Echoing their original meeting Lorne asks Lester if this is really what he wants yes or no: Lester now full of brio says yes. Lorne pulls out a gun and shoots his fiancé, the other dentist, and his wife right in front of Lester. He hits the elevator button to a service floor and asks Lester for his help to drag the bodies out. Lester whacks Lorne in the head with his Salesman of the Year trophy and takes off.

He runs and wakes up his wife, tells her to pack a bag and that it's time to get going. They head back to Bemidji. As they drive home she talks about how she always had a crush on him and how she once dreamed a man would come take her away from the drudgery of running a motel with her parents and he did. She's worried they left Vegas because of her. He says no and promises to make it up to her with another trip. She mentions Acapulco and he says they can go tonight. When they get home Lester looks out the windows for Lorne. He heads to the basement to get one of Chaz's guns that he inherited and tucks it into the back of his pants.

Meanwhile, in Fargo Budge and Pepper are still toiling away in the file room at the FBI. A man comes and asks for the Fargo Syndicate spree killing file. They want to know why. He says he's been getting calls about the case. They grab a post-it note with Molly's number from the guy and ask where Bemidji is.

In Bemidji, Lou, Greta, Gus, and Molly have breakfast and Lou notes Molly did well for herself with her new family. She gets a call from Vegas P.D. asking her to speak to a witness to a shooting in an elevator at a casino: Lester.

Molly shows up just as Lester has tucked away the gun. She explains why she's there. He tries to put her off but she claims she has to pee and comes in. They sit down and Lester lies and says he was a witness to nothing on the elevator and his wife covers for him saying it was her that wanted to leave early. Molly says she's getting some security footage from Vegas so not to leave town.

Gus is out on his mail route when a red BMW drives by. It catches his eye peripherally. Lorne is driving but,since he looks different, and saw him just for a moment, he doesn't make the connection right away.

Lorne goes to Lester's old house but he no longer lives there. As he's leaving he makes sure to say in front of the new owner's children that people were murdered in the house. The guy directs him to Lester's new insurance practice. Lorne drives by but it is closed.

Molly leaves Lester's and gets a call that the two FBI guys are headed to her dad's coffee shop to meet her.

Lorne is already there. He stops in for decaf and pie and to see if he can get Lester's new address out of Lou. He pegs Lou as a former cop. They have a very cryptic conversation in which Lou once again brings up the massacre he saw in Sioux Falls. Lorne notices Molly and Gus's wedding photo. Lou offers to give Lorne's number to Lester the next time he comes in but Lorne declines saying he's only passing through and wanted to surprise him.

The second he walks out the front door, Molly walks in the back. As Lorne's car pulls away Budge and Pepper pull up. They are excited that Molly may know who the Fargo Syndicate spree shooter was, noting they have a personal investment since they were there that day.

Molly takes them to the precinct and shows them her whiteboard of evidence and timelines. Bill comes in and is angry and tells the guys not to bother with her. They point out that they will indeed bother because Molly has done great work. They say they'll spend the night and go work Lester again in the morning. Bill sputters and Molly walks away trying not to seem too triumphant.

Gus goes into the room in his house where Molly has a similar whiteboard up. As he looks at it he remember the car driving by and slows it down in his memory, now realizing he saw Lorne for sure.

Lester meanwhile is printing out his one way boarding passes to Acapulco. He lies to his wife that Molly said it was okay for them to go but they have to go pick up their passports at his office. They drive over, Lester parks some distance away and then asks his wife to put on his coat, put up its hood, and go to the office to fetch the passports and money from the safe. He watches as she enters, turns on the light, goes to the safe and gets shot in the back of the head by Lorne. He watches as Lorne turns her body over and realizes it's not him. Lorne heads out front, lights a cigarette and walks away.

description: Molly takes the lead, while Gus pursues a hunch. Lester manipulates a situation, and Malvo finds a new target.
tags: ['broken leg', 'bear trap']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Fargo Morton's Fork- June 17, 2014

We pick up right where we left off with Lester in his car hyperventilating having just seen his wife shot. He calmly goes into his office and to the safe and takes out their passports and some cash. He flashes back to Lorne in the elevator asking if this is what he wants.

He puts their house and car keys in her hands. He heads to Lou's coffee shop and says his wife will be along presently but she had to get something at the office and he orders her a grilled cheese. He claims he has to use the bathroom and sneaks out the back and calls the police about shots fired. He goes back to the diner and again notes his wife will be along soon. Lou says he already said that. He also tells him that a man was in there looking for him earlier. Lester flashes back to putting the boarding passes to Acapulco in his coat pocket which his dead wife is now wearing. For a split second you can tell he's pondering going back to get them but suddenly police cars go screaming by. Lou notes nothing good will come of that. Lester agrees.

Molly, Gus, and Greta are watching "Deal or No Deal" when she gets the call that the second Mrs. Nygaard is now dead.

At Lester's shop, Bill explains what happened without getting too close to the body or the blood that makes him ill. Molly notes that she is wearing Lester's coat so just maybe she wasn't the intended target. Lester busts in pretending to be all upset and freaks out at the sight of the body. Molly wants to ask him some questions and wonders if this is connected to Las Vegas, a repercussion for what he saw. He realizes they are suspecting him and again he freaks out that his wife is dead and says he's going to be sick.

He asks if he can say goodbye. Bill says yes. He goes over to the body and attempts to snag the boarding passes but Molly notes it's an active crime scene and he can't touch the body and leads him away.

Lorne is holed up in a cabin when he hears on the police radio about the murder and Lester being picked up. He grabs some weapons and heads out.

The FBI guys are waiting in the Bemidji precinct and one asks the other if they are dreaming. Molly tells them about the plane tickets in Linda's pocket. Bill gives the coroner's report of one shot to the head. Lou shows up to tell Molly about the man coming into the diner. She shows him the security photos of Lorne and he says it could be him, but notes he changed his look. Bill comes by and says they're going to question Lester. Molly says she has to go. Lou notes that she doesn't. She tells him to call Gus for her and tell him it's going to be an all-nighter. He says he'll do one better and go over there and stand guard with a shotgun to protect his granddaughter. She tells him he's a good man.

Lorne arrives at the precinct. He jimmies open the FBI guys' car door and grabs a small black book out of the glove compartment.

Bill, Molly, Pepper, and Budge go to question Lester. They show him pictures of Malvo and he says he is not going to talk without a lawyer and he has arrangements to make for his wife. He says to lock him up or let him leave. Molly tries to appeal to him saying Lorne is not going to stop and Lester has to know it because a man like that might not even be a man.

Gus awakes to find Lou on his porch. Lou fills him in. Gus says he's going to Molly and asks Lou to watch over Greta. Lou says he will.

Molly briefs the other cops on how they're going to fan out to try and catch him. The FBI is sending in backup and Pepper and Budge will babysit Lester at his house. Gus calls and asks her to promise not to go after Malvo because he can't take Greta to another funeral. She notes it's her job and she is obviously itching to do it. He asks again saying he knows it's unfair to ask. She promises to stay at the precinct and coordinate from there.

After he hangs up with Molly, Gus is stopped short by a wolf in the road. The wolf wanders off and Gus watches. His eye lands on a red BMW in front of a cabin. He knows Malvo was driving a red BMW. He pulls off to the side of the road and approaches the house. As he does so, Malvo gets in his car and drives away. Instead of calling the police or Molly, Gus enters the house.

Molly goes to Bill and tells him the plan of trying to draw Malvo out by using Lester as bait and that the FBI is sending back up. A pensive Bill tells her he's quitting after this, he doesn't have the stomach for it anymore. He says he was not meant to contemplate the nature of life. She tries to persuade him a little bit but he notes that he's going to recommend her to be chief and that he knows Vern was behind her too. He says he hopes after she has the baby she will come back. She says she'll think about it. She tells him to keep his chin up.

Malvo calls the Bemidji precinct pretending to be FBI to get the agent's names. He then calls the FBI and pretends to be Budge, using the passcodes he stole from the small book he stole from their car, and says they've reached a dead end and calls off the back-up.

Malvo goes to a used car lot and asks to test drive an old car that looks exactly like an undercover FBI car. The dealer, the young man with the pregnant wife to whom Lester tried to sell insurance in the pilot, calls shotgun.

Pepper and Budge drive Lester home. On the way he solves the fox, cabbage, rabbit riddle. (Row the rabbit over since the fox won't eat the cabbage. Go back and get the fox but take the rabbit back. Leave the rabbit but take the cabbage back since the fox won't eat the cabbage. Go back and get the rabbit.) Lorne follows them. At home, Lester goes through the box of Chazz's hunting gear in the basement.

Back at Gus's, Greta brings Lou a cup of coffee. He talks about his time as a state cop. She asks if he ever stood guard like this before. He says once, in 1979, when Molly was four. She asks if the person came. He says it was less a who than a what and that it eventually did come. Greta goes back into the house and grabs her BB gun. He asks what she plans to do. She says she'll put the guys eye out and Lou can take care of the rest.

Molly is clearly restless and bored back at the precinct as the other cops check in with no news. She grabs her coat and tells the desk sergeant that she's going to Lester's house. The sergeant wonders if she's safe alone. Molly tells her to lock the door.

Lorne's dummy car approaches Lester's house. Pepper and Budge think it might be their back-up. They get out and asks the driver to step out. When no one does they draw their weapons and approach. They see that it is not Lorne behind the wheel but the dealer he bought the car from with his hands taped to the wheel. Lorne approaches them from behind and shoots them both dead. He looks at the guy in the car who begs him not to kill him since he has a child.

Molly drives.

Lester is upstairs wildly pulling clothes out of the suitcases they had packed for their trip. He pulls out his Salesman of the Year trophy and tosses it on the floor with the clothes. He heads back downstairs and sees that the doors are open on the FBI car and there are blood red tracks in the driveway in the snow. He races back upstairs and calls the police begging them to hurry. Lorne hears the call as he approaches and hears Lester say that the bathroom door doesn't lock. As he walks across the clothes-strewn floor however, his leg is caught in a bear trap, which Lester recovered from Chaz's gear. They take shots at each other and Lorne throws Lester's trophy at him and beans him in the nose. Lester dives into the bathroom. After a beat he heads out and sees Lorne is gone, having wrenched his leg out of the trap.

Lorne heads back to the cabin and tends to his messed up leg, quite expertly. When he has splinted it we see Gus approach from the side with his gun drawn. Gus says to him that he figured out his riddle about the shades of green. Lorne congratulates him. Gus then shoots him several times. Lorne is still moving, however, so Gus shoots him again and again. He is unsettled but Lorne is dead. He reaches over and grabs Lorne's knife.

Molly rolls up to the cabin. She and Gus embrace. He leads her inside and shows her the body. He points to a briefcase and tells her to open it. Inside are all of Lorne's tapes. She grabs the one marked Lester Nygaard and plays it and hears the call where Lester confessed to killing his wife.

An onscreen title tells us its Two Weeks Later.

We see Lester tooling along on a snowmobile at Glacier National Park in Montana. As he heads back he spies a phalanx of police waiting for him. He turns tail and the police give chase. Lester crashes his snowmobile. He begins running, right past a sign that says "Danger: Thin Ice." The police try to call him back but he doesn't listen. Cracks start to spider through the ice until suddenly a hole opens up and Lester drops through, leaving his hat floating atop the slushy water.

Molly, Greta, and Gus sit on the couch watching "Deal or No Deal." Molly doesn't share the news of her call. Gus tell her he's getting a citation for bravery. He says it should be her. She says, nope, that's his deal. She notes, with contentment, that she gets to be chief.

And that's a wrap on the first season of "Fargo."

description: Blade joins forces with Krista Starr to help her get revenge on an evil vampire who killed her fraternal twin brother.
tags: ['turned into a vampire', 'woman wears a tie', 'prostitute', 'hanging upside down', 'human experimentation', 'beaker', 'thirsty', 'playground', 'falling on a car', 'champagne', 'night cityscape', 'cocktail party', 'grand opening', 'art gallery', 'vampire ashes', 'vial', 'garlic', 'gun held to head', 'injected in neck', 'self injection', 'arm cut', 'throat cut', "visiting brother's grave", 'female topless nudity', 'piercing ripped out', 'getting a tattoo', 'body bag', 'morgue', 'return home', 'riding a motorcycle inside a building', 'blindfolded', 'wakizashi', 'dripping blood', "running for one's life", 'military dress uniform', 'detroit michigan', 'vampire hunter', 'interracial relationship']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Krista Starr [Jill Wagner] returns home from her stint as a sergeant in the US army only to learn within minutes of walking through the front door that her twin brother Zachary has been shot and killed. The detective on the case, Brian Boone [Bill Mondy], chalks it up to drug and gang activity because of the tattoo on Zack's neck [anyone who has seen the Blade movies will immediately recognize the tattoo as the sign of a vampire's familiar], but Krista maintains that Zack was not in a gang and decides to conduct her own investigation. Krista steals Zack's police file and learns that he and Danny Milano were previously arrested together. She confronts Danny, who provides no information but does drop a vial containing some druglike substance that Krista pockets. She googles glyphs until she finds the one on Zack's neck; the description directs her to Professor Melvin Caylo. Caylo identifies the stuff in the vial as Hominus nocturna (vampire) ash, worth thousands of dollars on the street. Kids use it for the vampire powers it gives them for a few hours. He identifies the glyph as the mark of a familiar belonging to the House of Chthon.

Vampires? There are no such things, Krista tells herself. On her way home, her car is rear-ended. When she gets out of her car to check on the other driver, someone steals her car. Then a voice whispers to her from inside a building, saying that he knows who killed her brother. When she follows the voice, she is attacked by two vampires. Fortunately, Blade [Sticky Fingaz] jumps in to ash the vampires after having followed Krista ever since he saw her snooping in Zack's apartment. Krista's disbelief in vampires is now a bit shaken, but she returns to the professor who tells her about Blade, the vampire hunter. Krista decides that she wants to get in touch with Blade, so the professor gives her Blade's only known address. When Krista goes snooping there, Blade confronts her again. He advises her to leave town before the vampires get her, but Krista refuses. She wants to hunt down the killer of her brother, and she won't leave. So Blade takes her in his confidence.

Blade has also been following the doings of Marcus Van Sciver [Neil Jackson], a high-profile developer who has been pumping his energy and money into redevelopment of historic buildings in Detroit. Sciver was pointed out to Blade as a member of the Vampire House of Chthon, and Blade wants to know where Chthon is located and what Sciver is up to. When Blade learns that Sciver will be present at an opening for the Sciver House Art Gallery, he asks Krista to attend the opening and plant a transponder on Sciver.

Krista is dolled up and looking fine (and in voice contact with Blade) when she walks into the reception room at Sciver Gallery. She attempts to plant the transponder on Sciver but he is too protected by his current girlfriend Chase [Jessica Gower] and his bodyguard Fritz. Instead, Krista introduces herself to Sciver as "Katherine," but he recognizes her immediately as Krista Starr, sister of Zachary. Krista escapes to her car and has an earphone delivered to Sciver so as to communicate with him. Sciver admits that he killed her brother; Zack was nosing around too much for a familiar, he says. Krista aims a sniper rifle at his head, but Sciver keeps moving and ducking behind humans. Concerned that Krista has screwed up, Blade hops on his motorcycle and heads over to the gallery. Unfortunately, before Blade can get there or Krista can fire a bullet, Chase sneaks up on Krista and captures her.

Sciver takes Krista to the House of Chthon. Without permission from the elders to create a new vampire, he injects his blood into Krista. Now, all she has to do is to die, so he tosses her off a 15-story building. Krista awakens several hours later to find herself in a bodybag in the morgue. She rips it open and runs outside where she is met by Fritz and Sciver, who take her back to the House to sleep it off. The next night, Chase is ordered to take Krista out and show her the ropes. Chase shows Krista how to find the safehouses of Chthon, warns her to stay away from House of Leichen, and takes her to the Chthon abbatoir for her first drink of blood.

Meanwhile, Blade is searching for Krista. He wants to find her before she accomplishes her first kill so that he can inject her with the same serum that helps him deal with his own blood thirst. First stop is to talk with Danny Milano. Just before Blade eliminates him, Danny gives him the name of a cop, Detective Brian Boone, who might know where to find Krista. Blade hides a transponder on Boone's car and follows him to the abbatoir. Turns out that Boone is a familiar who has a deal with the vampires. He picks up prostitutes, robs them, and then gives them to the vampires for food. Unfortunately for Boone, Sciver is displeased with him and gives him to Krista for her first kill.

So what has Sciver and the House of Chthon been up to? They're researching a vaccine that they hope will render vampires immune to the effects of garlic and silver. So far, it hasn't been successful. All the vampires on whom they have tested it end up ashing when sprayed with garlic. When Blade shows up at the abbatoir, Fritz begs Sciver to inject him with the newest serum so that he can fight Blade. Sciver is reluctant but agrees. This time it works. Blade is surprised when his silver bullets don't stop Fritz. Shen [Nelson Lee], Whistler's replacement, who is waiting outside, helps out by emitting a high frequency hum that hurts everyone's ears. Sciver calls Fritz off, and Chase and Krista attack Blade. Blade stabs Chase with a silver stake, putting her out of action. Shen emits a second round of high frequency whine, allowing Blade to hold Krista down long enough to inject her with his serum.

Blade drives off on his motorcycle with Shen following. Weakened from his fight with Fritz, Blade has a hard time staying on his cycle and eventually falls off. Shen picks him up. Krista goes back to her apartment. She tries jumping from her window to a distant rooftop and finds that she has the power. The serum is making her think more clearly. She goes to the cemetery to visit her brother's grave. Blade meets her there. He explains how the serum works and invites Krista to work with him, just like her brother was doing.

description: Krista has a bad dream where she bites her mother's neck. Both Blade and Marcus starts to hunt an ash dealer, Cain.
tags: ['female police officer killed', 'police', 'police officer', 'female police officer', 'female uniformed police officer', 'uniform']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A lucrative trade has developed in which vampires are captured and harvested for ash, which has become a popular street drug because it gives snorters all the powers of a vampire albeit temporarily. Krista has returned to House Chthon to spy on Marcus van Sciver for Blade. She keeps herself lucid with injections of Blade's serum, which she keeps hidden in her shower drain. Blade and Shen are worried that Fritz is a new kind of vampire who is impervious to garlic and silver, so Blade has asked his friend, the Reverend Carlyle who works with ashers (kids that are addicted to vampire ash) for anything he might know about Fritz. Reverend Carlyle suggests that Blade talk with an ash dealer named Cain.

Meanwhile at House Chthon, Winston Haup from the Prague office has arrived to evaluate Sciver's vaccine, which they are now calling "Aurora." Marcus informs Winston that they are moving Project Aurora operations to the west coast and that several test subjects are currently being transported there. One of the subjects is Detective Brian Boone. Sealed in an airtight bag, Boone's body is in the back of an American Butcher truck on its way through Rapid City, South Dakota, when Boone suddenly regains consciousness. He pulls out one of his fangs, uses it to cut open the airtight bag, and escapes.

While Krista and Marcus dine at the Lotus restaurant and Blade attempts to beat information about Cain from an asher, Cain has followed Winston on his way back to the airport. When Winston makes a stop at Mina's to sample some American cuisine (an honor student plucked off a beach in Cancun), Cain kills Winston's driver. When Winston returns to the car, Cain ashes him and delivers his remains to the ash lab. When Marcus gets word that Winston missed his flight and that the tracking device on his car went dead outside of Mina's, Marcus and Chase pay Mina a visit, and Marcus shuts down her business by ripping out her heart. Marcus does not think Winston was taken by Blade. He would also have come for Mina and her clientele, Marcus reasons, so he has Chase grab a young asher named Shari and torture her until she reveals who was involved in Winston's disappearance.

Blade has gotten word to Krista asking her to find out about Fritz. Krista waits for a time when she's alone with Fritz and gets him to tell her about Project Aurora. She then asks Marcus to inject her with the vaccine, but he refuses. Partly to remove Fritz from a possible confrontation with Blade and partly because the board in Prague wants proof of Aurora's success, Marcus arranges to send Fritz to Prague, something that doesn't make Fritz very happy, as he wants another chance to finish off Blade.

Chase is successful in getting Cain's name and location from Shari. She puts together a team to make a hit on Cain's lab. Blade hasn't been successful in getting information out of the asher, so Blade has had him dumped on the side of a road, figuring that he will run straight to Cain to warn him. Blade figured correctly, and now Blade also plans to make a hit on the lab. When Chase's team, which includes Krista, gets to the ash lab, they find it abandoned save for the asher, who is bound and gagged and tied to a chair. As one of the team members starts to rip the duct tape from the asher's mouth, Krista realizes that it is a trap. She and Chase manage to jump to safety just as the duct tape is removed, revealing a bomb stuffed into the asher's mouth and set to detonate when the tape is removed.

Just after the bomb explodes, Blade enters the lab. As he prepares to destroy Chase, a car suddenly breaks through the door, knocking Blade to the ground. Fritz hops out and confronts Blade. "Let's finish this," Fritz growls, and he and Blade go at it. When Blade knocks Fritz to the ground, Chase picks up her machine gun and open fires on Blade. Chase orders Krista to kill him, but Krista grabs a "Caution: Hard Hat Area" sign and uses it to whack off Fritz's head. Krista then falls on a broken post that goes right through her abdomen, back to front. Marcus has Krista taken to a hospital while Blade returns to Shen to have the dozens of bullets removed from his body.

Meanwhile, somewhere in Kansas, a state trooper comes upon a car with South Dakota plates seemingly abandoned at the side the road. She finds a man's body in the back seat and calls for the coroner and a tow truck. Then she hears screams coming from the trunk. She opens it to find a women inside. As she calls for an ambulance, the trooper is suddenly attacked by the man from the back seat. He turns out to be Detective Brian Boone.

description: Marcus orders Krista to deliver a bag to Vanessa, and Blade hunts the doctor who makes vaccine to vampires for Marvus.
synopsis_with_character_names:
[INCONGRUITY: In 1.02 Death Goes On, Chase orders Krista to kill "him," seemingly referring to Blade, but Krista beheads Fritz instead. However, in the recap shots at the beginning of Descent, Chase specifically orders Krista to kill "Fritz".]

FBI Agent Ray Collins [Larry Poindexter] arrives at the scene of the Kansas state trooper's murder. Watching the patrol video, he sees a man biting the trooper's neck. Next to the car, he finds a fang. When he is alerted to the American Butcher incident in South Dakota, he begins to wonder whether there might be some connection and starts asking questions.

Krista is beginning to heal, helped by Marcus rubbing a bit of his own blood into the wound. When Krista is well enough to pay a nostalgic visit to her mother, she finds Blade waiting in a car outside the house. Blade warns Krista not to maintain ties with people from her human life lest Marcus catches on. He then asks her what she's learned about Fritz, and Krista tells him about the Aurora Project. Blade charges Krista with getting a sample of the vaccine. She tries several times to get into the lab where the Aurora vaccine is stored, but each time she is interrupted by Cress, one of Marcus's guards.

Marcus sends Krista on an errand to deliver a satchel to a woman named Vanessa. Marcus doesn't tell Krista what's in the bag, and Krista doesn't peek, much to Chase's disappointment because Chase doesn't like or trust Krista. Still, Marcus has charged Chase with grooming Krista and teaching her the ropes. So, the next night Chase takes Krista on a public kill. They pose as two members at an AA meeting where they meet two guys -- Theo and Chuck -- "the dregs no one will miss." Chase lures them into an alley where she drinks from Theo and kills Chuck by breaking his neck. Krista is saved from having to drink Chuck's blood when two other guys pass by and ask if they are all right.

Meanwhile, Blade has gotten a lead on a disfigured vampire named Sands who may have been one of Marcus's failed experiments. He tracks Sands to a casino and pulls from him the location of the experimental lab. Blade, Sands, and Shen break into the lab, but it looks deserted. Suddenly, they are attacked by a half-dozen or so vampire goons. Blade manages to destroy them all. In the rubble and ash that remains, Blade finds a scalpel with 10A06-PA67-8 engraved on the handle. Tracing the number on the Internet, Shen tracks it to the medical practice of Dr Jeffrey Vonner and Associates. When Blade crashes Vonner's office, however, he only finds a bunch of pregnant women.

A visit to the South Dakota crime lab has turned up some interesting findings for Agent Collins. The remains in the back of the American Butchers truck has turned out to be human ash. Prints found on the cab window have been identified as those of Detective Brian Boone. When Collins holds the vial containing the fang up to a window to take a better look, the fang suddenly disintegrates into ash. What is going on here?

description: Blade is caught by a group of vampires called Bad Blood, a group that Blade first turned.
synopsis_with_character_names:
The moment Jeffrey Vonner sees Blade enter the reception room, he puts a gun inside his mouth and pulls the trigger. The screams of the patients and nursing staff bring security running, allowing Blade no time to get his hands on Vonner's files. Blade jumps out of a window and runs to his car. On the windshield, he finds a handwritten note that says, "HEY THERE LITTLE MAN." As Blade is trying to figure out its meaning, he is run over by a large, black, armored van. As he lay in the street stunned, four hooded goons carry him away. Shen caught the whole thing on his videocam and is now contemplating whether or not to initiate shutdown protocol.

While Shen looks for Blade, everyone else is looking for Brian Boone, the missing detective. Boone's picture is plastered all over the newspapers under the headline "Killer Cop?" Collins has teamed up with Boone's old partner, Detective Gibbs. Together, they search Boone's apartment, hoping to find a clue to his whereabouts. All they can find, however, is a book in German and another one entitled House of Armaya. Marcus has ordered Chase to take Krista to the House of Leichen in Oregon and have them put her through a ritual that will place her in mind contact with Boone. Although this is a dangerous and bloody procedure, Marcus is certain that Krista will be able to connect with her first kill, afterwhich she and Chase are ordered to find and eliminate him.

When Blade regains consciousness, he finds himself in chains and face-to-face with Reverend Carlyle. Carlyle explains that it was he who had Blade captured, because he doesn't like the fact that Blade is letting ash-makers go free. (Blade figures they kill vampires, so they're performing a public service.) When the four goons take off their hoods, Blade is surprised to see members of his old "family," -- Steppin' Razor, Run Run, Bolt, and Jaws -- collectively known as the Bad Bloods, all vampires now because Blade fed on them when they took him in as the scrawny little kid they called "Little Man." They didn't know that he was a bloodsucker. Turned by Blade the Daywalker, the Bad Bloods have been unable to find acceptance in any of the vampire houses, and they see Blade as their ticket in.

Before Krista leaves for Oregon, she pays a visit to Blade's hideout, an abandoned factory called Woodworks, where she learns from Shen that Blade has been taken off the street by four hooded vampires. Krista assures Shen that Marcus had nothing to do with it and tells him about Boone. She asks Shen what he knows about the House of Leichen. Shen warns her not to go through with the ritual, then announces that he's about to torch Woodworks. "What happens to me?" Krista wonders. "We all got problems," is Shen's reply. He sets Krista up with a bagful of serum and goes back to listening to his videocam. With her superhearing, Krista can pick up the muffled conversation and hears the words "Bad Blood," which seems to ring a bell with Shen.

Meanwhile, Blade is getting more and more hungry without his serum. Carlyle tries to convince Blade that the Bad Bloods are trying to stop killing and that they just need some of his serum. Blade knows better. "They don't want my serum," he tells Carlyle. "They want me. And now that they've got me, you're just their next meal." True to Blade's prediction, the Bad Bloods run a stake through Carlyle's chest and feed on him. Their real plan is to gain entrance to the House of Chthon by delivering Blade to Marcus.

Shen has been doing a little online research about the Bad Bloods and found that there was a fifth brother, Jermaine Turner, who was shot and paralyzed. He locates Turner at a soup kitchen in a park and asks him where to find the Bad Bloods. He then returns to Woodworks, loads up on weapons and serum, and heads to the warehouse where Blade is being held. As the Bad Bloods drag Blade to the truck in order to deliver him to Marcus, Shen blasts a hole in the ceiling and starts shooting. He manages to ash one of the Bad Bloods as well as shoot several vials of serum into Blade. Unfortunately, Steppin' Razor leaps at Shen and knocks him to the floor, possibly breaking Shen's arm. Blade quickly regains his strength and ashes two more of the Bad Bloods, leaving him one-on-one with Razor. Razor decides to cut his losses and runs. By the time Marcus arrives to pick up Blade, the only thing left is a note from Blade that says, "Suck me."

As Collins pages through the books found in Boone's apartment, Gibbs brings in a box filled with all of Boone's open files from the past three months. Amongst the files for runaways, prostitutes, and pushers, Collins notices the file for Zachary Starr. Attached to the file is a picture of a female army sergeant who has also come up missing. Collins thinks it might be wise to find and talk to her.

Krista and Chase have arrived at House of Leichen, where Krista is introduced to Dr Miranda Berganza, who informs her that the first step in the vision process will be to place her on dialysis in order to clean the "stink" from her blood. She then meets Frederick, who is introduced as Chase's ex-husband and who will be Krista's guide through the ritual. Frederick explains that the process works because both Krista and her first kill (Boone) are linked because of their shared death experiences. What the ritual will do is to step up Krista's sensory awareness to the point where she can tune into Boone's energy and be able to know his whereabouts at any time. He warns her that she will come out of this ritual with extreme blood thirst and that she must be careful not to drink too much or Boone's energy will take over her soul. "It's already lost," is Krista's reply.

As the ritual begins, Krista approaches a large blood bath. She drops her robe and slowly steps into the bath. Deeper and deeper she enters until her entire body and finally her face slip under the blood.

description: A bloody ritual visualizes for Krista where Boons is heading. Blade focuses on Vanessa Simms who is very pregnant, as Krista searches for the Aurora vaccine. Marcus gets a surprise visit.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Krista emerges from her blood bath with the news that Boone is on his way to Silvan, Louisiana. After she has had a chance to clean herself off and secretly shoot herself with the serum, Krista is informed by Frederick that it took her five hours to seek her vision whereas the longest emersion time for any other vampire has been 27 minutes. It is Frederick's conclusion that Krista rejected the connection because either a) she doesn't want Boone found, or b) she is rejecting the vampire world. Krista makes up a story about once having a relationship with Boone. Frederick buys her story but, after Krista has left the room, he notices one of her serum vials on the floor.

When Marcus hears that Boone is headed for Silvan, he realizes that Boone may be headed there to request an audience with the pureblood vampire Damek, head of the House of Armaya. Since Marcus has been testing his vaccine on Armayans and fears that Boone will spill the beans, he orders Chase and Krista to follow him to Silvan and eliminate him.

Meanwhile, Blade has been lurking outside the church where Dr Vonner's funeral is being held on the chance that he might catch a glimpse of someone or something. It's daytime so, of course, Marcus doesn't show. However, Blade notices a young pregnant girl. From the blue glow in her abdomen, Blade is certain that the child is not human. Shen identifies the girl as Vanessa Simms, a single, boyfriendless, low-paid, waitress-type who watches movies on a $9000+ plasma TV. Blade and Shen conclude that she may be being paid to carry a vampire baby, so Blade decides to follow her.

Boone has made it to the House of Armaya and requested audience with Damek, but Damek's goons are giving him a hard time until Boone reveals that he knows who is responsible for "disappearing" Armayans. Just as the goons are about to lead Boone to Damek, Chase and Krista break into the garage and start shooting. Krista goes after Boone, but he grabs Patricia Barton, a human woman that he kidnapped as a present for Damek. Boone attempts to waylay Krista by ripping open Patricia's neck. As Krista fights the urge to drink Patricia's blood, Chase corners Boone in the rest room and ashes him through the door. Thinking they have eliminated Boone, Krista and Chase return to House Chthon, not realizing that they ashed a goon, not Boone.

Marcus is having his own problems. One of the pureblood board members from Prague has decided to make a surprise visit to House Chthon in order to check on the Aurora Project. The diminutive Charlotte, accompanied by her hulking bodyguard Thorne, is concerned that a full-scale war will break out with the Armayans unless the Chthons can strike first and in daylight. Marcus assures her that Aurora will work and that he will step up development. What Marcus doesn't know is that Charlotte is suspicious of him and has ordered a covert, full-scale audit of the House of Chthon.

Blade has learned through his contacts that a girl fitting the description of Vanessa Simms has just arrived in Berlin. When Krista stops by Woodworks for more serum, she informs Blade that Chase has been sent to Berlin. Blade decides that he should go to Berlin, too, but he first reminds Krista of the importance of her getting a sample of the Aurora vaccine.

Back in a Louisiana hospital, Collins is speaking with the physician who is attending Patricia Barton after she was found wandering on a roadside with her larynx torn open. He tells Collins that Patricia muttered something about a soldier woman helping her. Collins shows Patricia a picture of a vampire from the book he found in Boone's apartment, and Patricia's blood pressure shoots to the ceiling while she points at the fangs.

Once in Berlin, Blade is directed to the Melinger Klinik where Vanessa is being drugged and kept chained to a bed and watched over by Chase. Seeing that the Klinik is heavily guarded, Blade kills one of the guards and gains entry through a back door. He plants a bomb set to detonate in four minutes then goes in search of Vanessa, eliminating a few goons along the way. When Chase sees that Vanessa is missing, she runs after them, but Blade and Vanessa make it outside with only seven seconds to spare. Unable to go out into the sun, Chase hangs back. Suddenly, the Melinger Klinik explodes into flames.

Trying to find a way to get her hands on the Aurora vaccine, Krista has just realized that she might be able to reach the lab by crawling through the tunnels under the House of Chthon, which started life as the Hotel Matador. She locates a book about the hotel in Marcus's library, rips out a page detailing the complex of tunnels under the hotel, finds her entry and exit points, and begins her crawl. She successfully reaches the lab and obtains a vial of the vaccine.

On her way out of the tunnel, however, Krista is met by Marcus, who noticed the misplaced book in his library and figured out right away what was going on. Krista tells him that she wants the vaccine in order to get her old life back, but Marcus informs her that the vaccine doesn't work. "Fritz would have started to deteriorate in a few more days," he tells her and confesses that the vaccine is really just a stepping stone to raise the House of Chthon to a position of power. Then he offers a choice to Krista. Either live with him or die in her old life. Krista offers him her hand.

description: Hardly alive Chase is brought home to Marcus who orders Krista to bring back Vanessa.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Blade and Vanessa have made it out of Germany and are on their way into Paris. It's not without strife, however, as Blade has handcuffed Vanessa to her seat and promised to shut her up if she tries to scream. Still, Vanessa refuses to talk about Dr Vonner or what he did to her baby. When Vanessa says that she needs to use the restroom, Blade escorts her down the hall, but they are attacked by two snarling vampires. Realizing that Blade is protecting her, Vanessa helps by stabbing one of the vampires with Blade's silver knife. The vampire immediately turns into ash. Now willing to talk about Vonner, Vanessa says that he simply offered her money for being a surrogate mother for a childless couple. She knows nothing more.

Marcus and Krista are attending a showing at one of Marcus's art galleries when Krista meets up with her Uncle Pat. Pat first chews out Krista for not visiting with her mother then informs her that Lisa is sick and in the hospital. At the same time, Marcus receives a call informing him about Chase being badly burned in the explosion at the Klinik in Berlin. Marcus drags Krista away from her uncle, and they make it back to the house just as Chase's badly burned body is wheeled into their makeshift hospital. Chase barely manages to whisper "Blade" into Marcus's ear, as Marcus orders Krista to leave immediately for Berlin to locate and bring back Vanessa. On her way to the airport, Krista makes a short stop at the hospital to see her mother, but Lisa is asleep. Uncle Pat tells Krista that her mother has been diagnosed with leukemia and is going to need a bone marrow transplant. When he tells her that the marrow will have to come from her because he isn't a match, Krista refuses. Uncle Pat accuses her of using drugs, and Krista walks away.

After being transfused with dozens of pints of blood, Chase is improving, however Marcus is in trouble with Charlotte. Charlotte wants to know what Chase was doing in Berlin, so Marcus tells her that Chase was attempting to retrieve a stolen "asset." Charlotte then informs Marcus that she has received a message from Damek, the leader of the Armayans. Damek has somehow learned that Marcus was using Armayans as guinea pigs and wants to meet. When Marcus, Charlotte, and her bodyguard Thorne arrive at the rendez-vous spot, Damek states his terms. He wants House Armaya be admitted to the governing body and forgiven for their attempts years ago to destroy the other houses. Furthermore, he wants this done by the end of the week or he will destroy House Chthon by revealing to the other houses the experiments they have been doing with Aurora, hoping to make Chthon the strongest house of all. As Damek backs away, Marcus asks how Damek learned of Aurora, and Damek produces Sands.

Blade and Vanessa have made it to Paris. Blade takes Vanessa to be seen by a doctor he trusts. The doctor performs a sonogram and is amazed to find that Vanessa's womb contains only fluid, so he suggests amniocentesis. However, before the doctor can set it up, Krista arrives, having been diverted to Paris on Marcus's order after he learned that Blade was there. Krista stands with Vanessa as the doctor performs a D&C, removing a liter or so of the bloody fluid. He cannot identify the contents but is certain that it is incubating some sort of "biological substance." Blade takes a sample of the fluid, and Krista takes the rest of the sample back to Marcus, but not before allowing Blade to gouge out her eye so that Marcus won't become suspicious. Vanessa is sent into hiding.

Meanwhile back in Silvan, Louisiana, Collins is searching the house where Boone stayed. He digs a bullet out of the woodwork and scrapes up some ash from the floor just as he gets a call from his superior, Mack Sorenson, ordering him to step down from the case and return to Kansas. Collins refuses.

description: An old friend from Blade's childhood is murdered.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Steppin' Razor has returned, and he's hellbent on getting revenge by killing off everyone who was once close to Blade. First to go is Detective Donny Flanigan, an ex-cop who befriended Blade when he was still little Eric Brooks, living at home with his father on pints of blood stolen from the blood bank. Flanigan is the person who first introduced Eric to Abraham Whistler. When the dispatch appears on Shen's computer screen that Flanigan was found dead of an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head at Garrity Gun Range, Blade and Shen hurry down to see. One look and Blade can tell that it wasn't self-inflicted. Flanigan's gunhand is broken, and there is a chess knight shoved in his mouth. The knight leads Blade to a second victim, Mr Taka, a sympathetic store-owner who taught young Eric to play chess. Blade and Shen drop in at Taka's house and find him in his kitchen with his neck slit. Blade fears that his childhood nurse, Viola Watkins might be next, so he has Shen do an internet search to determine her whereabouts.

Krista's wound to her eye is improving, but her mother has gotten much worse. Lisa has begun coughing up blood and is on a morphine drip. It looks like her death is imminent, yet Lisa refuses to go to the hospital to die. Uncle Pat says that they must let Lisa go, but Krista has another idea. She breaks into Woodworks while Blade and Shen are away and steals several vials of serum.

Charlotte's snitch Glynnis has been unable to find anything incriminating on Marcus. Money for the Aurora Project has been laundered through his legitimate businesses, and there is no evidence of any unauthorized side projects. However, Glynnis has found out that the Aurora project has been shut down except for one facility outside of Reno, Nevada. Damek is continuing to send Armayans for experimentation, as per a deal with Charlotte, but all ingoing Armayans are destroyed soon after their arrival with no evidence of being used for experiments. Charlotte suspects Marcus may be using the Reno facility as theater in an attempt to either delay or distract them. Glynnis still has two investigators in the field, and she proposes to personally investigate Krista Starr more thoroughly. Charlotte approves of the plan as well as the human infant Glynnis has procured for Charlotte's dinner.

Shen has located Viola Watkins. She changed her name To Sally Porter in 1981 and now runs the Queen of Mercy Clinic. Shen and Blade hurry over, but they are too late. Razor has already been there. They find Viola's body in a tub, covered with water. Blade pulls her out and begins resuscitation. Fortunately, he is able to breathe life back into Viola. She describes her killer to Blade, who immediately recognizes him as Razor. Then Viola drops a real bomb. He's on his way to kill Blade's father, she says. Blade is nonplussed. He saw his father die in 1977, shot by a hood who was trying to hold up Taka's market. No, says Viola. He didn't die, and he came back to Detroit two months ago.

Blade returns to the house where he grew up. It is dilapidated and abandoned, and his father is not there. But Razor IS. Blade and Razor have at each other. Suddenly, a sword is thrust through Blade and into Razor. Razor ashes, and Blade falls to his knees. He sees his father standing there. Robert attempts to make peace with his son [Eric ran away from home when he came to believe that his father was going to abandon him to Abraham Whistler], but Blade tells him to "go to hell."

Collins has tracked Krista to Detroit but cannot find her. He's called Lisa'a house and learned from her nurse how to get in touch with Pat. Pat admits that he does not know Krista's whereabouts either, but he does know that she's been hanging around with Marcus van Sciver, whom he characterizes as Detroit's "answer to Donald Trump."

Actually, Krista is at her mother's house as they speak. She has decided to turn her mother and then provide her with Blade's serum. She shows Lisa the vial of serum, calling it "medicine," and says that she will give her the medicine, but first she has to do something that will hurt. She bites Lisa's arm, drinks some of her blood, and then smothers her with a pillow, all the while crying "I love you, mom!" "Wasn't that touching," says a voice. Krista turns to find Glynnis in the doorway, holding the bag with the serum in it. Glynnis admits to following Krista and threatens to tell Marcus about the serum. Krista bares her fangs at Glynnis. Glynnis bares her fangs at Krista. Suddenly, the door opens to show FBI Agent Collins standing there with his gun pointed at them. Krista and Glynnis both bare their fangs at Collins.

description: Krista asks Blade for help as her mother has run away, and Alex wants to save Chase from Marcus.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Krista has problems. FBI agent Ray Collins can't believe what he's seeing as Krista and Glynnis have at each other, fangs baring. When Krista succeeds in ashing Glynnis by stabbing her with a silver-backed mirror, Collins shoots several bullets into Krista's abdomen. In the melee, Lisa has revived and jumped out the window without receiving any serum. Meanwhile, Blade has discovered that most of his serum is missing and reviewed the security video to see Krista hanging from the ceiling and filling her bag with serum vials. Blade immediately figures out that Krista means to turn her dying mother. Blade and Shen go snooping at Lisa's house, but no one is there. Suddenly the door opens, and Krista drags herself in. "I can't find her," she moans. "Help me."

Chase is in Las Vegas, attempting to close a deal with club owner Taylor, but Taylor isn't budging. Chase offers him $2 million over the asking price, but Taylor laughs in her face, so Chase returns to her hotel suite in defeat. Suddenly, there is a knock on her door. She opens it to find an old flame, a pureblood vampire named Alex, standing there with a bottle of wine and two glasses in hand. Alex wants to rekindle their relationship, even though Chase is merely a turnblood. Chase, who has been feeling uncomfortable with her position with Marcus ever since she botched the Berlin situation is only too ready to jump into bed with Alex...until Marcus catches them in flagrante delicto. Against Alex's wishes, Krista returns to Detroit with Marcus.

Trying to catch up with Krista's mother before daybreak, Blade, Shen, and Krista race over to her Uncle Pat's house, but it's too late. Lisa has been there and gone, and Pat is lying dead on the floor. Blade beheads him to make sure he stays that way. Lisa spends the next day in a storage locker, poring over pictures of Krista and snacking on a security guard. Come evening and with no idea where Lisa might be hiding, Blade suggests that they stakeout the cemetery where Krista's brother Zack is buried, until Krista remembers that her mother saw Krista being turned by Marcus in her ADE (After Death Experience). Krista feels certain that Lisa will try to find her through Marcus.

Meanwhile, Collins is obsessing over what transpired when he caught up with Krista at her mother's house. Collins remembers Pat telling him that Krista was hanging around with Marcus van Sciver, so he arranges a meeting with Marcus at his office at Van Sciver, Inc. As he sits in the reception area waiting to see Marcus, Collins watches a distraught woman (Lisa) enter the lobby, shouting for her daughter. Security leads her into a back office just as Krista comes in the front door. Fortunately, Krista recognizes Collins and ducks behind a pillar just as the security guards bring out her mother, bound and strapped to a gurney. Krista tries to follow, but Collins is looking in her direction, so she stays put as her mother is placed in an ambulance. When Collins is summoned by Marcus's secretary, he turns away. Krista runs outside, and she and Blade follow the ambulance in Blade's car.

Collins' audience with Marcus is not very productive. At first, Marcus denies knowing either Zack or Krista Starr. When Collins provides Pat's statement that Krista has been hanging with Marcus, Marcus concocts a story about how he is involved with Krista but that, because of his public position, he needs to maintain discretion. Marcus denies knowing how to reach Krista but does say he will have someone look into it and offers to meet Collins in a nearby park to exchange information. As Collins sits in the park, waiting for Marcus, he is met by his FBI superior, Mack Sorenson. Sorenson reveals that he has had a call from Marcus Van Sciver and that he has been ordered to relieve Collins from duty. After having his gun confiscated, Collins attempts to explain all that he has seen. When he starts to go on about a conspiracy and about Marcus not being human, Sorenson humors him and suggests that they return to headquarters.

Inside the ambulance, Lisa learns that she is not being taken to a hospital. She is, in fact, in a vehicle for the transportation and disposal of stray vampires. When the attendant draws up a big syringeful of garlic extract and prepares to inject it, Lisa breaks free of her restraints and attacks the attendant and then the driver. Right before Krista's eyes, the ambulance crashes and overturns. When Krista opens the ambulance doors, she sees her mother feeding. Blade and Krista take Lisa back to Woodworks where Krista injects her with several vials of serum, but it's not working. Shen concludes that Lisa has fed too many times and been vampire for too long for the serum to work. Lisa breaks loose of her binds and turns on Shen. With tears in her eyes, Krista destroys Lisa.

Alex has shown up at House Chthon offering to buy/rescue Chase for $2 million. Marcus does not put up a fight and, in fact, suggests that they three drink a toast to "new beginnings." When Alex next wakes up, he is strapped into a chair in Marcus's laboratory. Technicians are preparing to inject him with the Aurora vaccine. Chase explains that Alex is helping them to prove that the vaccine works and that even purebloods can be destroyed. Alex's body then disintegrates.

description: Marcus seeks Krista's love and sympathy by showing her how he was turned into a vampire.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Having just destroyed her own mother, Krista is drowning her sorrows drinking shots alone in a bar. Worried about Krista, Marcus has sent Chase out looking for her. Since Shen's friend Dr Chang has identified the Aurora vaccine as a "keyhole" virus, designed to target the specific DNA sequence of pureblood vampires, Blade and Shen are also looking for Krista so that they can question her about Marcus's intentions. Chase is the one who first finds Krista and brings her back to House Chthon. Drunk and filled with bitterness, Krista attacks Marcus, drawing his blood. Marcus wipes the blood off his cheek and smears it in Krista's mouth, causing her to have a vision of his own ADE.

It is 1899. Marcus and his wife Isabella have moved from London to Detroit and purchased a building with the intent of turning it into a store and making themselves a home. One day, as work to set the store in order before the opening, Marcus is visited by Damek and two of his goons. Damek demands that Marcus pay a weekly protection fee, but Marcus declines. The next day, Damek returns and again demands payment. When Marcus again refuses, Damek has his goons begin to destroy the store. Damek takes Isabella and drinks her blood, killing her. He then has Marcus nailed inside a coffin that they deliver to a tribe of vampire Indians who feed off Marcus until he begs for death.

Meanwhile, Shen gets an email from a street snitch who saw Krista picked up by Chase, so Blade heads over to House Chthon to see if he can find a way in. Blade and Shen enter through the sewers, following the same tunnels that Krista took to break into the laboratory and steal a sample of the Aurora vaccine. Unfortunately, they find that Marcus has had the tunnels sealed and shock-sensitive security alarms placed on them. Looking for another way in, Shen notices an IT Line and taps into the security cameras so that they can locate Krista's whereabouts in the house and follow her movements...until security disarms their taps.

Now that House Armaya has been reinstated, Damek has decided to place more demands on Marcus. He arranges for an audience with Marcus, during which he demands a piece of every one of Marcus's holdings. Marcus refuses. Fueled by memories of what Damek did 100 years ago to his wife, Marcus attacks Damek and ultimately destroys him.

FBI agent Ray Collins has agreed to return with Mack Sorenson to FBI headquarters and tell his story to the upper brass, that is, until he notices the mark of a vampire's familiar on Sorenson's arm. Collins whips Sorenson around and smashes his head through the car window. With nowhere to go, Collins runs to the house of his friend Jessica Ellis, the lab technician who provided him information about the findings in the Kansas and South Dakota incidents. When he tells his story to Jessica, she surprises him by agreeing with him that there is something unusual going on. She's been doing a little digging herself and gathered together files on other cases with similarities. Just after she copied and returned the files to the person who gave them to her, that person and everything about him disappeared. Collins is afraid that he is on his own, but Jessica says there may be someone who can help them. That someone is Blade.

Having seen Marcus's ADE, Krista has become more sympathetic to Marcus. When he is hurt in his fight with Damek, it is Krista who takes him to his bedroom and dresses his wounds. She kisses him and, before she knows it, they are making love to each other. What she doesn't know is that Blade is peeking in the window, watching.

description: Bethany asks Shen to find her sister who's disappeared from a waitress job in a night club.
tags: ['human skin mask', 'bound and gagged', 'human tooth', 'handcuffed to a table', 'captive', 'dungeon', 'henchman', 'vampire girl', 'killed with razor', 'child vampire', 'gore', 'slasher', 'masked killer', 'psycho killer', 'albino', 'religious fanatic', 'female victim', 'jaw ripped off', 'topless woman', 'bursting into flames', 'serial killer']
synopsis_with_character_names:
When Jennifer meets Zed at the Blast, she likes what she sees and readily shares a drink with him. When Jennifer next wakes up, she finds herself chained to a pole in front of a wall of TV screens and sees some guy in a white mask coming at her with a pincers. She can do nothing but scream.

After making love to Marcus, Krista is in turmoil, feeling the loneliness of being caught between two worlds. Instead of taking her next dose of serum, she smashes her remaining vials against the shower stall and goes feral. Before she can feed off anyone, however, Blade finds her and takes her to Woodworks. There, he injects her with serum and tosses her into a detox tank, informing her that, if the detox doesn't work, their partnership is over and she is ash. He then closes the door on her and lets her go cold turkey.

Back at the Blast, waitress Nicki is angry because Zed stiffed her again for his drinks and tips, so she goes looking for him in the back rooms. That's the last time anyone remembers seeing Nicki. Several days later, Nicki's sister Bethany meets with Shen and their mutual friend Daniel. Bethany has asked Daniel to help her find Nicki, and Daniel thinks Shen may be of service. At first, Shen doesn't want to get involved...until he sees a photograph of Nicki with someone's arm around her. On the wrist can clearly be seen the mark of a familiar. The odd thing is that it isn't a glyph from any of the known vampire houses. Blade recognizes it as the glyph of the White Prince, a rogue vampire attempting to start up his own following. While Shen researches the White Prince, Blade goes looking for the White Prince's familiar.

Worried because her snitch Glynnis hadn't returned from following Krista, Charlotte has come to the conclusion that Glynnis is dead and ordered Thorne to pick up Chase and bring her to New Orleans. Charlotte wants Chase to be her eyes and ears in House Chthon. When Chase returns to Chthon, she tells everything to Marcus. Marcus decides to let Chase run with it and offers to let her take to Charlotte, as proof of her intention to work as Charlotte's spy, a broken sword that he once took from Blade. Chase returns to New Orleans and presents the sword to Charlotte. "Marcus first," Chase promises. "Blade next." Charlotte is happy with their arrangement.

While Krista continues to thrash around in Blade's makeshift detox tank, Blade returns with the news that he's found out where the White Prince's familiar hangs out, and it's the same club in which Nicki worked. Shen tells Blade what he's learned about the White Prince...he appears to show up every 19 years and may have been one and the same with the 15th century sadist Gilles de Rais, Garrick the Butcher in 16th century Germany, and the Red River man in Seattle in the early 1900s, all of them torturers and murderers. He wears a hood because he is said to have somehow disfigured his own face with silver. Concerned that the White Prince might disappear for another 19 years if he finds out that Blade is after him, Blade suggests they take a quieter approach, like sending in Bethany as a decoy.

Bethany is more than willing to pose as the decoy, so Shen wires her with a transponder. Shen and Bethany go into the Blast while Blade waits outside in the car watching the exit. When Bethany is approached by a guy who starts pawing her, Shen springs into action, taking swings at the guy, asking him where he took Nicki, and rolling up his cuffs in search of the familiar glyph. Unfortunately, there is no glyph, but the disturbance has given the White Prince's familiar enough time to connect with Bethany and whisk her away. Shen informs Blade that Bethany has disappeared, but Blade never saw her leave the club. Blade then notices that the transponder indicates Bethany is still inside.

Shen goes into the men's room to the blood off his hands. Kurt the bartender enters the room and begins to wash his hands, too. Shen notices the four bloody scratches on Kurt's arm and surmises that they may have been made by Bethany. Shen knocks Kurt against the wall and notices the White Prince's glyph on his other wrist. Hearing the commotion on his earphones, Blade decides it's time to make his entrance. He comes barreling into the club, and the patrons scatter in fear. He follows a trail of blood that leads through a toilet stall to a secret door. Blade busts through the door and, hearing screams, finds himself in the video room where a tape of Jennifer being tortured is playing. Blade rips out the tape and then goes in search of Shen.

The White Prince finds Blade first, and they beat on each other, breaking down doors until Blade is in the room where Shen is being held in chains. Using his foot, Blade breaks the chains, setting Shen free. As Blade and the White Prince continue their fight, Shen goes looking for Bethany. What he finds is ghastly...bloody bodies of girls, some still alive, Nicki and Bethany among them. Just as Shen is about to cut them free, he is jumped on by Kurt, but Shen manages to stab him with a straight-edge razor.

The fight between Blade and the White Prince has moved outside to the roof. When the White Prince tries to convince Blade that he is a specially-appointed seraphim, Blade retorts, "You're nothing but another crazy-ass vampire." The White Prince roars angrily and leaps at Blade. Another fight ensues. It ends when Blade rips off the White Prince's lower jaw and tosses his body outside into the light of the rising sun. The White Prince turns to ash even before his body hits the ground.

When Blade and Shen return to Woodworks, they discover that Krista has succeeded in breaking down the door into the detox room. They find her seated in a corner, apparently having made it through the withdrawal from blood thirst. As Krista picks up her things and prepares to leave, Blade reminds her that Marcus is soon going to make his move on the purebloods, and he wants Krista to find out when. Krista doesn't think Marcus trusts her enough to confide in her, so Blade orders her to make Marcus trust her.

description: Charlotte and Thorne suffer an air crash. Blade and Collins go to the crashed plane to investigate.
tags: ['female villain', 'child villain', 'evil child', 'necklace', 'dying friend', 'killing a friend', 'one liner', 'cutting stomach', 'deep cut', 'regeneration', 'crawling up a wall', 'making an offer', 'child vampire', 'vampire girl', 'infected', 'manhunt', 'airplane crash', 'jealous girlfriend', 'female female kiss', 'stabbed in the head', 'bodyguard', 'suicide by proxy', 'mercy killing', 'vampiric infection', 'massacre']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Charlotte and Thorne are returning to Prague in order to brief the Chthon board of purebloods about the conclave that Marcus is planning. Somewhere over northern Michigan, their plane explodes, thanks to the bomb that Marcus had Chase deliver along with the sword she presented to Charlotte.

Blade and Shen are chilling in Woodworks when the security beeper goes off. Someone is attempting to break in. He has managed to pry the lock and open the door, but Blade coldcocks him before he gets very far. Shen paws through the guy's wallet and discovers that he is FBI Agent Ray Collins. Collins explains that he wants to join Blade in his hunt for vampires. Blade refuses, until he receives a hurried phone call from Krista informing him that Charlotte's plane went down. Blade wants to search the crash area for anything which might reveal the location of the conclave, but Shen says it may take hours, even days, to find it. Collins offers to get the location from the FBI's access to NAF Star 3 overflights, but only if Blade will agree let him tag along. Eventually, Blade relents. Once they have determined the location, Blade and Collins head north.

Marcus has his hands full with Tucker Moffot, the architect he has retained to make alterations on the ventilation system in the building in Toronto that he has acquired for the conclave. When Marcus "negotiates" with Tucker by breaking his assistant's neck, Tucker agrees to speed up the alterations in time for the conclave. Marcus assigns Cress to follow Tucker's every step.

Charlotte and Thorne, the only vampires to survive the crash, have had their strength restored by feeding on two campers. After walking most of the night, they have made it to the small town of Meadow Lake and taken refuge in the Emerson County Elementary and Junior High School where faculty and students are preparing for the annual pancake breakfast. When lead teacher Bobbie Lotink goes into the pantry to get more powdered sugar, she is surprised to find a wounded man lying on the floor. She bends over to tend to him and doesn't notice Charlotte hanging from the ceiling. When Charlotte leaps on her, it is already too late.

Hours later, when Blade and Collins make it to the school, they find everyone drained of blood. When Blade gets ready to behead the victims so that they don't turn, Collins hears a sound. Thinking there might be survivors, they go to search. Suddenly, they are attacked by Bobbie Lotink and another vampire. Blade ashes them both but not before Bobbie stabs Collins in the leg with a butcher knife. The cut has severed his femoral artery. Unable to continue on, Collins suggests that Blade keep looking for Charlotte while using himself as bait for the vampires who are soon to rise. Reluctantly, Blade gives Collins two ultraviolet bombs. After promising that he will destroy Collins if he falls prey, Blade mops up Collins' blood and drags the mop down the hall to attract the vampires then goes off in search of Charlotte and Thorne. The vampires begin to awaken and follow the trail of blood. When they have all entered the room in which Collins' is lying on the floor, he sets off the bombs and ashes the lot of them.

Meanwhile, Blade has found Thorne and Charlotte. Thorne manages to toss Charlotte out of Blade's way, then he does battle with Blade until Blade succeeds in ashing him. Dragging himself down the corridor, Collins looks up a staircase to see the diminutive Charlotte hiding there, looking for all the world like a scared 12-year old. "I just want to find my daddy," she says, and Collins succumbs. Minutes later, Blade finds Collins lying on the stairs, his neck chewed up. He looks up to see Charlotte perched in a corner of the ceiling. Knowing she has nowhere to run, Charlotte offers Blade a deal. If he will allow her to get to the conclave, she will secure him a place in the family where he can find safe haven and hone his many skills. Blade appears to consider it for a moment, then he tosses a silver blade right into Charlotte's chest. Charlotte turns to ash. Turning to Collins, Blade promises to get him out of there, but Collins knows it's too late. He thanks Blade for allowing him to kill a few monsters, then makes Blade keep his promise to destroy him before he turns into one himself.

Back at House Chthon, Chase's jealousy of Krista has hit critical mass since she saw Krista wearing the necklace that Marcus years ago gave to his wife Isabella. When Krista comes out of the shower, she finds Chase in her room, sitting in a chair and waiting for her. After calling Krista a "hollow little girl playing hollow little games," Chase warns Krista about needing her as a friend in the days to come, then she slinks out of the room.

Back at Woodworks, Shen has finally discovered the location of the conclave...Toronto.

description: Marcus plans a full-scale attack on the pureblood Vampires as they gather to celebrate their ultimate triumph and Marcus prepares to execute his apocalyptic plan.
tags: ['reference to nagasaki japan', "attempted coup d'etat", 'two man army', 'villain gets away', 'cat fight', 'falling to death', 'shot in the shoulder', 'open ending', 'cliffhanger ending', 'silver bullet', 'broken sword', 'relic', 'sword fight', 'sword', 'melee combat', 'biological weapon', 'assassination', 'melting', 'convulsion', 'one liner', 'strangulation', 'capture', 'jealous girlfriend', 'revenge', 'spiteful woman', 'infiltration', 'traitor', 'reference to world war two', 'elite', 'conclave', 'meeting place', 'self rescue', 'rescued by friend', 'woman rescues man', 'last second rescue', 'assistance', 'pulling out eyeball', 'floating eyeball', 'finale', 'fingernail torture', 'military assault', 'pulling out fingernail', 'torture', 'dropped pants', 'condom']
synopsis_with_character_names:
The Toronto property is ready for the Conclave, and Marcus and Krista are in Toronto checking it out. Architect and contractor, Tucker Moffot, points out the new ventilation interface, large bore air-conditioning ducts, and doors that require laser confirmation of retinal identity. Marcus is pleased with the results. What pleases him more, however, is that Blade won't be dropping in unexpectedly. Marcus has discovered Blade's hideout and is sending Chase and her team to destroy it and Blade with it. On the flight back to Detroit, Krista ducks into the lavatory and phones Blade, warning him to get out.

But it's too late. As they speak, the lights in the Woodworks building suddenly go out. The ultraviolet lights kick in but then go out, too. Suddenly, Chase et al storm the building, machine guns ratatatting. Blade yells to Shen to blow up the lab. Shen manages to set the destructor but, before he can press "execute," he is hit in the crossfire. As Chase drags Shen's body from the building, Blade hits "execute". A few seconds later, the entire place explodes.

When Shen awakens, he is in House Chthon, strapped into a chair, Chase taunting him with a tray of torture instruments laid out before him. However, Marcus wants Chase to leave immediately for Toronto in order to oversee the arrangments, so he leaves it up to Krista to apply the torture, assuming that she's had some experience with it during her stint in Iraq. With Shen's blessing, "Just do it, you bloodsucking bitch," Krista pulls out a few of Shen's fingernails. She also slips a scalpel under his hand so that, when Marcus and Krista leave the room in order to catch the flight to Toronto, Shen is able to cut the straps that bind him and escape.

Contrary to the belief that Blade is dead, Blade is quite well, thank you. He assembles what remaining arms he can find in the rubble and prepares to leave for Toronto. It is Blade's desire to be there for the slaughter of the purebloods in order to make sure Marcus pulls it off. However, he first has a stop to make in order to get his "key" into the Conclave. "Don't worry," he tells Turner Moffot as he wields a knife. "I only need one." Blade cuts out one of Turner's eyeballs. Then he takes Turner's car, picks up Shen, and they're off to Toronto.

At the Conclave in Toronto, Chase has taken over security and had the Aurora canisters installed. The purebloods have started to arrive. Unbeknown to anyone, Blade and Shen have also arrived. After making proper obiescence to Lord Rusk, Marcus retires to the waiting room while the purebloods talk amongst themselves. Chase presents Marcus with the button that will unleash the Aurora vaccine when he pushes it. Then comes the summons. The purebloods are ready for Marcus's address. And so it begins.

After subdued fanfare on Marcus's part and sighs of disgust on the parts of the purebloods, Lord Rusk tells Marcus, "Just give us what you came to give us." Marcus pulls the vial of Aurora from his pocket. "Happily," he says and then smashes it in his hand. "It never worked," Marcus admits, "but don't worry, I've come to deliver what you really deserve." Marcus pushes the button...and nothing happens. Lord Rusk stands up and addresses the other purebloods, apologizing for not telling them about Marcus's subterfuge. "We thought it was important that Marcus reveal himself," Lord Rusk explains.

"We?" asks a surprised Marcus.

Chase steps forward and spitefully tells Marcus, "Charlotte gave me a simple choice...you or the House of Chthon. Much as I've grown to care for you, I thought it was more prudent to bet on the House."

Meanwhile, Blade and Shen have broken into the security room and found that the lines to the Aurora canisters have been cut. Afraid it will take too long to re-establish the lines, Blade seizes one of the canisters of Aurora and races to the Conclave. All hell has broken loose, but Blade says simply, "You can't have a party without the cake." He tosses the canister into the air then shoots it. The canister explodes, the vaccine disperses, and the purebloods disintegrate.

Blade turns on Marcus in the Conclave, and Krista takes on Chase in the hallway. Krista succeeds in tossing Chase over the banister and watching her fall a dozen stories to the marble floor at the bottom. When she returns to the Conclave, she sees Blade standing over Marcus, poised to drive a sword through his chest. "Blade!" Krista screams. Blade looks up, and Marcus rolls away. Suddenly, Shen shows up shooting silver bullets. One of them hits Krista in the shoulder, but she immediately pulls it out. Marcus grabs Krista, and they both go barreling out a window. Fortunately, it is night.

Some days later, Marcus and Krista have returned to Detroit and are looking at the mess they made of Woodworks. Marcus knows that Blade will eventually turn up again in a new hiding place, and Krista warns Marcus that they will need to lay low themselves. Marcus reminds Krista that he still has the Aurora vaccine, so power over the purebloods is still in his hands. Krista asks Marcus how he learned the whereabouts of Blade's hideout, and Marcus tells her about intercepting and tracing a phone call. Suddenly, Marcus grabs Krista by the hair.

"How long have you been working for Blade?" he growls.

A lawyer struggles to endure his first terrifying week in prison; an Irish gangster seeks revenge on the inmate who shot him.
