Grace points out that her brother-in-law could die, and suggests that another psychic, Raikou, can help Brainwave, despite the fact that she's a contract killer. Despite Utopian's objection, Grace tells Brainwave to find Raikou.

In Tokyo, Raikou attacks a Yakuza funeral procession and the bodyguards draw their swords to match hers. They fight and Raikou kills them, then advances on their boss the Rook. Walt projects a mind palace around Raikou and confronts her, and she asks what her father wants.

In the real world, Rook approaches Raikou's frozen body.

Walt tells Raikou that he needs a favor.

Rook calls on his surviving bodyguards.

Raikou tells Walt that a favor will cost him $1 million a day, plus expenses. He agrees, and frees Raikou from her fugue state. She kills the bodyguards and then Rook.

1929

As the expedition prepares to take a dinghy to the island, Sheldon says that after his father's funeral, his "ghost" appeared to him and tried to determine if they're worthy of whatever is on the island waiting for them. He tells Richard that he saw the island appear out of nowhere, and Richard is a part of it. Richard thanks Sheldon for rescuing him from the ocean, but he's not going with him and the others to the island. Sheldon figures that Richard is a man who wants to make a difference, and Richard says that Sheldon has no idea what he lost when his ship went down. Considering, Sheldon says that there's when someone has nothing left to lose, they have everything to gain.

Going up to the deck, Sheldon tells Borges that his crew shouldn't go on the island. Borges gives the expedition three days to return before they go back without them. The captain gives Sheldon the confiscated sidearms back, and Richard comes out and gets in the dinghy. He points out that they still have their lives left to lose. and they're in Sheldon's hands now.

Now

At the farm, Brandon and Chloe watch a newscast about Janna's death, and Chloe says that she just saw Janna but she wasn't in a good place at the time. Brandon wonders if he set everything in motion by killing the clone, and Chloe tells her brother that someone lives and someone dies no matter what they choose. Regardless, at least Brandon figures that he made a choice.

Chloe sarcastically figures that Brandon could be the next Utopian with an attitude like that, and isn't interested when Brandon suggests that she come by when their parents are there. However, she says that she'll think about it. and leaves.

1929

The expedition lands on the island and Grace takes more photos. Sheldon doesn't know where to go next, then leads the other five inland.

Now

At the Union hall, Sheldon asks Grace what it was about. She says that she made a decision, and Sheldon says that she doesn't need to be adding to the dissension. He says they need to show a united front, and Grace tells Sheldon that she can't when she disagrees with him. Grace tells him that he isn't succeeding in keeping everything from falling apart, and the Code is broken. Sheldon insists that the Code isn't broken but being challenged, and Grace insists that the Code is broken when Ghost Beam died and Baryon lives.

Sheldon wonders if they should abandon their values, and Grace says that she doesn't know but she wants to discuss options. She figures that Sheldon wants to stick to the code because he needs it more than ever, and a shocked Sheldon leads her into the conference room. Grace points out that Sheldon is trying to take away free will be enforcing the Code, starting with her, Chloe, and Brandon along with the young supers. They feel like the older heroes don't have their back, and are scared as a result.

Grace says that they're asking the young supers to believe in something that doesn't make sense anymore, and Sheldon asks if that's how Grace feels. His wife says that she lost her curiosity, and she won't sacrifice truth anymore. Sheldon asks her what she wants him to do, and Grace tells him to listen and hear what people are saying and what they're afraid of, and then talk to them. She says that he needs to do what they did on the island to earn their powers, and Sheldon tells Grace that she has no idea what he needs to do. With that, Sheldon walks out.

1929

The group proceed through the forest and Richard complains that they're not getting any closer to the mountains in the distance. When the others move on, Walt hears something moving in the forest. Walt joins the others, and Sheldon finds patterns seemingly grown into a tree. They're the same patterns that Sheldon drew from his visions, and Richard goes on and finds something.

Richard calls the others over, and they see mountains across a desert. He says back to the ship and turns, and a tree grow up in front of him. When Fitz and Richard try to go around it, more trees grow up in front of them, blocking their path. George figures the island won't let them leave.

Now

On the Sampson farm, Petra comes to see Brandon and says that she has to talk to him. Petra says that she's thinking about leaving the Union, and Fitz told her that it was her decision. Brandon says that she can't leave the Union because others would follow, and Petra tells Brandon that she doesn't believe in the Code anymore. Brandon admits that he's had doubt about the Code, and he remembers what Sheldon once told him that they have to care about people and the world, and that's what separates them from everyone else.

1929

Snow comes down and the temperature drops, and Walt figures that if they have to keep going then there has to be a way back. George figures that the island is alive, and asks if the others agree with Walter after what happened. Noe one does, and George tells Walt that he's on his own...again. Sheldon says that they have to cross the desert to see what's out there. Walt questions his brother's sanity, and Sheldon clutches at his head in pain and says that he didn't ask for it. His older brother says that Sheldon never had to ask for anything, and Sheldon tells Walt to go out on his own and sees how he fares. He says that not everything works out the way Walt wants it to, and tells him to deal with it for once.

Walt starts to walk away and Grace stops him. She figures that Sheldon is right and they have to cross the desert, and Walt finally nods in agreement.

Now

Blackstar is in his cell at Supermax, reading. Brainwave comes to see him and says he's there to give Blackstar his last chance. He explains that he's going to "hack" into the clone's brain, and will soon know everything. Brainwave asks Blackstar if he's working with Skyfox, and Blackstar says that he knew Skyfox was at least honest with himself and not a fraud like Utopian and the other Union members.

Brainwave makes Blackstar's brain forget how to breathe, cutting off the villain's rant, then tells Blackstar that he's going to dig into the clone's mind. If he doesn't find what he's looking for, he'll come back and dig into Blackstar's mind and leave the villain with nothing yet. Brainwave restores Blackstar's ability to breathe, says that he's not his brother and doesn't care if he kills, and leaves.

1929

The party crosses the desert, and Grace wonders why Chester came to Sheldon and not Walt. Walt figures that Sheldon is still the "golden boy", and George complains that Walt always rebuffs him when he opens up to him. The two argue about Walt leaving when he doesn't feel heard, and talks about how when Walt was young, he'd lock himself up in a dark room or burst into tears. Sheldon tells George to stop and continues on, and the others follow him.

Fitz asks Walt who he would choose if he could see someone he lost again, and says that he'd choose his grandmother, who was the smartest person he knew. Grace, overhearing says that she's choose her uncle, who was a bird photographer and she hated birds. Richard says that he'd choose Phillip, another doctor, who died when their ship went down.

George says that he'd choose his mother, and he'd do anything to say goodbye. He asks Walt who he would choose, and Walt says that he'd choose no one because he doesn't live in the past. A dust storm comes toward them from the mountains, and sweeps over them. They manage to join hands, and Sheldon leads them on.

Now

Brainwave meets Utopian and Grace at the hall, and an out-of-costume Raikou comes in. She tells them that a job's a job, and when she mocks Utopian, Brainwave telepathically tells her not to push it because Utopian is barely tolerating her being there. Raikou's father says that she's glad his daughter is there, and Raikou says that she's good at what she does. Brainwave agrees, and Grace draws their attention back to the real world.

1929

The party makes their way across the island, and Sheldon leads them along a ledge in one of the crevasses surrounding the mountain. Sheldon asks Walt if it's true what he said earlier about Sheldon being Chester's "golden boy", and he thought Walt was their father's favorite. Walt says that Chester treated him like an employee, and Sheldon suggests that he lighten up. He then says that his problem is taking a back seat to a younger brother who never deserved half the attention he received, and who had everything handed to him. Sheldon insists that it's not true, and Walt tells him that Chester would still be alive if they had listened to him.

Walt freezes up, muttering about how Chester didn't listen to him, and Sheldon makes his way back to his older brother. He holds his hand out, and grabs Walt when the ledge breaks beneath Walt. The party reaches a crevasse and enter it, unaware that it's part of a vast pattern.

Now

Fitz and Petra use their powers to activate the clone's brain.

1929

The party makes their way through the crevasse, and comes to a chamber filled with roots and the skeleton of ancient Vikings entwined in them. There are other skeletons in the clothes of different centuries Walt grabs Sheldon's machete and hacks at the wall blocking their way on, and the walls shake and Sheldon clutches at his head in pain. The walls move, closing the crevasse behind them and forming a well around them, and Richard grabs the discarded machete and charges at Sheldon, blaming him.

Sheldon says that it's another test, and he and Richard fight while Walt draws his gun and George tackles him to stop him. Sunlight shines down from the top of the well, highlighting the skeletons, and Grace realizes that the previous visitors killed each other. She tells the others that the earlier visitors killed each other, and the mountain is pitting them against each other to test them.

Grace points out that all they've done is fight since they got off the boat, and points out that the groups of visitors make six each. Sheldon figures that whatever is testing them wanted to see if they could overcome adversity together, meaning there has to be a way out of the well.

When Sheldon and George touch the walls, patterns glow under their hands. Sheldon has them put their hands back, and the patterns glow and spread. Sheldon has the others touch the walls, figuring they all have to be there, and the rest of the party does so. When Walt touches the wall, his pattern and George's disappear. Sheldon tells them that they have to let things go.

The two men do so and touch the walls. Sheldon's pattern disappears, and Grace figures that it's about Sheldon and Walt. They put their hands on each other's shoulders, and all the patterns light up.

A door in the wall opens and a light shines out. They step into the chamber beyond.

Now

Brainwave and Raikou scan the clone's mind, and Fitz tells them to hurry before the clone flatlines. Father and daughter join hands and redouble their efforts, and Brainwave determines that the mental path he took the last time has collapsed. . He says that something isn't right and freezes up, then collapses moaning in pain. Grace and Sheldon go to Walt, while Raikou keeps the path to the clone's mind open. She warns that if closes, Walt won't get out.

1929

The party find themselves in a vast empty cavern that shows a planetary landscape. There's a glowing 3-dimensional pattern hovering in the distance, and the party approaches it. Chester emerges from the pattern and the others can also see him. "Chester" tells them that they've completed the ordeal, and they've succeeded where others have failed.

Image of the others that each person described earlier appears and talk in chorus, saying that the party has suffered unthinkable loss, but have prevailed. The party has been found worthy, and energy bursts from the pattern and enshrouds them.

The energy hits the ship, and the crew watches the island disappear. As Borges orders a departure, the six members of the party fly up and hover above the ship.

description: As Walter's situation grows dire, Sheldon and Brandon join forces in a do-or-die showdown with a supervillain. Hutch runs into trouble during a heist.
synopsis_with_character_names:
At Supermax, Blackstar is in his cell reading his bodice-ripper book. His cell door opens on its own, and Blackstar considers his situation.

1929

The radio has newscasts about sighting of the six new superbeings. Walt joins Sheldon at a diner, and warns that if they keep resisting in public places like Sheldon wants, eventually someone is going to recognize them. Sheldon is reading a newspaper about Lady Liberty breaking up an armed robbery, and tells Walt that he worries too much. Sheldon insists that nobody has recognized him as Utopian yet, and no one will recognize them..

Walt makes a sarcastic remark about George fitting his "fat head" into his helmet, and dismisses his comment as a joke. Sheldon doesn't believe it and tells his brother that all six of them have to work together, and assures Walt that no matter how close he and George are, it'll never touch the bond they have.

Now

Walt screams in pain from his link with the clone, while Fitz confirms that the clone's brain is breaking down and it goes entirely, it'll take Walt with it. Sheldon angrily tells Raikou to do what she can and storms out.

At Hutch's place, Chloe wakes up when she hears Hutch dressing to go. He says that he's meeting with his crew, and it's better if Utopian's daughter doesn't know who they are. Chloe isn't thrilled with Hutch keeping secrets from her because of her father, and he says there's part of their lives they don't share with the other. Chloe says that her dating the son of the world's greatest super-villain would never work, and leaves.

Later, Hutch meet with crew and tells them who he's been dating. He apologizes for not bring it up before and says that they've got a job to do. They refuse to work with him and leave, and Hutch teleports to Shenzen, China.

In the Union hall, Brandon joins Sheldon and says that he got there as soon as he could when he heard about Walt. He assures his father that Walt is in good hands, Sheldon talks about the responsibility he felt when he gained his powers, , and the responsibilities involved sacrifices including losing Skyfox, who was close to him.

Sheldon explains that Skyfox thought the Code held him back, and he felt he could do more for the nation without it. They discussed it, and Skyfox broke the Code anyway. That was the beginning of the end for Skyfox and the Union, and he became the Union's worst enemy. Sheldon tells Brandon that he can't lose him like he lost George, and Brandon assures his father he won't lose him. and says that he told Petra what Sheldon told him. Now Brandon has realized why the Code is so important to Sheldon, Sheldon says that he's been holding on too tight, and he needs to talk and listen more.

Petra comes in and tells them that Blackstar is loose, and Sheldon and Brandon are the only "majors" available.

In Shenzen, Hutch teleport into an airless vault. He can't speak in the vacuum, and quickly finds the deposit box he's looking for, as four air-masked men come in behind him. They fight, and Hutch manages to defeat all four of them and take one of their masks. A guard recovers and clubs him from behind, and two others join in on beating on Hutch.

Chloe bursts in, creating a hole that lets oxygen in. She takes out the guards, but one of them shoots her. Chloe dismissively shrugs off the shot, throws him across the room, and Hutch realizes that she's been following him. Chloe smashes open the box and takes out the power cell.

Walt tries to fight his way out of the clone's disintegrating mind.

At Supermax, Sheldon and Brandon go in and have the guards lock them in. they split up to search for Blackstar.

Walt finds a room in the clone's mind with a mental replica of George. George throws a table at Walt.

At Supermax, Blackstar ambushes Paragon and beats him.

Skyfox and Walt fight, and Skyfox punches Walt. In the real world, Walt's body starts to die. Grace tells Fitz to get her into the clone's mind, and Raikou warns that Grace could be trapped with Walt.

Utopian finds Blackstar grabbing Paragon, using him as a hostage. He invites Utopian to kill him, and asks if Utopian can kill to save Paragon, like Paragon killed the clone to save Utopian. Blackstar asks if the Code comes before family.

Skyfox tells Walt that this time Utopian won't be there to step in and save Walt, and Lady Liberty arrives and punches Skyfox away. Recovering, Skyfox shoots Lady Liberty with his electro-gun, immobilizing her.

Blackstar says that Utopian can either kill him, and everyone will lose faith in the Union. Or Utopian will lose his son. As Utopian starts to use his heat vision, Flare II arrives and blasts Blackstar from behind. Utopian moves forward and punches Blackstar, and Utopian and Blackstar fight. Flare II joins the battle, and Blackstar knocks her back and starts kicking Utopian.

Skyfox tells Walt that the last time they met, the Union beat him to a pulp while Hutch watched. The villain points out that he's the only one who originally believed in Sheldon and his visions, and it's time to settle old debts. Walt attacks him, and Skyfox catches his fist and says that it would be too easy to kill Walt. He grabs Walt's head and shows him how it ends.

Paragon recovers and attacks Blackstar, and he remembers Utopian saying he isn't close to being ready. He punches Blackstar unconscious, but stops rather than kill him. He helps Utopian up, and Utopian tells his son that he wasn't going to let him die. Paragon says that he knows and walks away.

Walt and Grace wake up in the real world, and Walt thanks Grace for helping him. Fitz asks what they saw in the clone's mind, and Grace tells him that they saw Skyfox.

Fitz confirms that they're physically okay, and Grace figures that Skyfox let them go because he sent Walt a message. Walt says that he should tell Sheldon first, Grace objects and tells Walt to show her, and he telepathically projects the message into her mind. It's of Skyfox standing over the bodies of Utopian and Paragon, and Walt explains that George cloned Blackstar, knowing that Blackstar would give the Union the most trouble. The "Skyfox" in the clone's brain was an ambush, and warns that Skyfox is coming for all of them

Fitz says that won't happen, and Grace says that if Skyfox thinks he's going to come for her family, he's got another thing coming. She says that they will bring Skyfox to justice.

At his apartment, Hutch takes Chloe to his secret workshop . He explains that he's going to use the power core to find his father, and has no answer when Chloe asks him what he's going to do next.

1929

The group gathers and Fitz wonder why Skyfox was the only one who got a Power Rod. They're in the Union Hall, and Sheldon reveals their meeting table. Sheldon insists that they're all worthy, and Walt figures they were given their powers so they could rule the world. Then he dismisses his comment as a joke. and George says that they could get the country back on track. Walt agrees with him, but Sheldon says that they don't govern and don't kill, and that's the Code.

Sheldon says that they can all agree that America is teetering on the edge, and they have to think about how they can help the country get back on its feet.

Now

Walt calls Raikou to a mindscape of a penthouse apartment, and Raikou tells him to show his appreciation for her saving his life by depositing her million dollars promptly. She says that he liked her mother but didn't love her, because that would require commitment and Walt couldn't do that. Walt tells his daughter that's on him and he takes full responsibility.

In the Union Hall, Walt is sitting and in telepathic communication with Raikou. Sheldon comes in. As Sheldon hugs his brother, glad to see him alive, in the mindscape Raikou says that she knows Walt cloned Blackstar and made it look like Skyfox was behind it, and that Walt found a way to release Blackstar from his cell, knowing only Utopian and Paragon would be available to come there when Blackstar broke out.

Raikou figures that Walt wants to split Utopian apart from his son, which creates instability in the Union... which will force new leadership. Walt tells Raikou that the country is spiraling out of control because of Sheldon's attitude, and there's no one else to blame.

In the real world, Sheldon tells Walt that he might need his help on another matter. He's worried that he might be losing Brandon, and he can't lose him like he lost Chloe. Walt says that he'll make sure that doesn't happen,.

Raikou tells Walt that she doesn't care about the Union or America, but Walt is going to have to pay her to keep quiet about what she knows. When Walt wonders if she can be paid to turn against him with a higher offer, Raikou tells her father that he can trust her.

Walt tells Sheldon that he can trust him.

Disgusted, Walt tells Raikou that Grace brought her in, and he thought Raikou would come over to his side. But he dismisses her as a disappointment like everyone else, and telepathically immobilizes her when Raikou draws her sword. Walt kills Raikou and kisses her cheek.

Walt stands with Sheldon, a hand on his brother's shoulder.

description: Aliens abduct Yakko, Wakko, and Dot. Inspired by the Orson Welles "War of the Worlds" radio drama, Brain stages a similar hoax on television, hoping to cause a nationwide panic.
tags: ['stargazing', 'alien abduction', 'reference to andromeda', 'reference to elvis presley', 'bigfoot', 'amelia earhart', 'jimmy hoffa', 'reference to yoda', 'character can see subtitle', 'reference to james doohan', 'wish granting', 'reference to war of the worlds', 'rubber band', 'reference to desi arnaz', 'reference to h.g. wells', 'alien invasion', 'plan to take over the world', 'reference to wisconsin', 'reference to ed wood', 'reference to orson welles', 'reference to plan 9 from outer space', 'unidentified flying object', 'flying saucer', 'alien', 'alien experiment', 'mind reading machine', 'female anthropomorphic animal sexually attracted to a man', 'sexual harassment played for laughs', 'casual sexism', 'sexist humor', 'cat calling', 'xenomorph', 'interspecies alien romance', 'horny man chasing a woman against her will', 'spoof of the war of the worlds radio broadcast', 'the war of the worlds radio broadcast', 'lab mouse', 'studio guard', 'hand drawn animation', '2d animation', 'animals family', 'farce comedy', 'kids family', 'parody comedy', 'quirky comedy', 'showbiz comedy', 'sketch comedy', 'slapstick comedy', 'urban adventure', 'classic animation']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Aliens abduct Yakko, Wakko, and Dot from their log cabin in the woods. While the aliens try to study them, the siblings cause chaos as they mock, outsmart, and evade their captors. They especially enjoy playing with the subtitles that appear when the alien language is spoken.

Yakko meets and endears himself to the alien leader (a giant toe) by grooming it. When the Warners end up gaining control of the ship, they make it fly all over the place erratically. Eventually the aliens get exasperated and deposit the Warners back in their cabin where the giant toe is waiting to be groomed some more.

Inspired by the Orson Welles "War of the Worlds" radio drama, Brain stages a similar hoax on television, hoping to cause a nationwide panic. He pretends to be a newscaster while Pinky pretends to be an alien, using video cameras to create the illusion that they are human-sized.

With sets built from cardboard, Brain frantically reports on the alien invasion as Pinky destroys everything around him. Pinky messes up by wrecking part of his costume, but the audience seems to be enthralled by the performance anyway. The hoax is successfully broadcast, but much to Brain's dismay, the audience finds it funny instead of scary.

description: Jaime finds out her old adversary Carlton Harris has been laying traps for her in order to test her Bionic abilities. So she decides to play into his hands by pretending to have had enough of working for the OSI and infiltrate Carlton's organization.
tags: ['close up of ear', 'second part', 'comma in title', 'colon in title', 'punctuation in title', 'reference to the declaration of independence', "character says you've come a long way baby", 'brake failure', "stopping car with one's foot", 'smoking shoes', "character says let's get out of here", 'house bugged', 'fire escape', 'reference to harvard law school', 'reference to allen funt', 'evening dress', 'man wears a tuxedo', 'man wears a blue tuxedo', 'man wears a white tuxedo', 'breaking into a safe', 'exploding safe', 'top secret document', 'woman wears a fur coat', 'gun with silencer', 'rebellious son', 'evil father', 'character name in episode title', 'number in episode title']
synopsis_with_character_names: As Jaime and Oscar have recently discovered, corrupt industrialist Carlton Harris -- who saw Jamie's bionic powers in action when she and Steve unsuccessfully raided his complex several months previously, on The Six Million Dollar Man -- has been secretly testing Jaime to see what she can do. Though Oscar thinks Harris wants to kill Jaime, she feels it's more likely he wants to buy her services. So Jaime and Oscar stage several fights over her salary, prompting Harris to make Jaime an offer. Once inside his organization, Jaime's plan to entrap him is complicated by the villain's devoted son, who must help her if she is to finally capture her first evildoer!

description: Jaime goes on a rescue mission to Costa Bravo disguised as an army nurse. She is accompanied by cranky helicopter pilot Jack Starkey. Their mission: to find the American ambassador and his wife.
tags: ['last minute escape', 'orphan boy', 'killing a snake', 'propeller airplane', 'helicopter crash', 'elementary school teacher', 'pinned under debris', 'banana republic', 'south america']
synopsis_with_character_names: On the very day Jaime's middle school class discusses a sticky situation developing in Central America, Oscar arrives hat in hand to ask her to fix it! The American ambassador to the republic of "Costa Brava" and his wife are trapped in the rubble of a bombed out building in a remote jungle patrolled by bloodthirsty rebels, and only Jaime can save the day, because the man she's sent in with is too afraid of getting shot to give any thought to finding the ambassador.

description: Beloved school bus driver and local mechanic Harry Anderson gets in trouble when he is recognized by a couple of thugs. It turns out he's been hiding out in Ojai for 15 years ever since witnessing a club owner being murdered.
tags: ['close up of ear']
synopsis_with_character_names: When the school bus driver who takes Jaime and her class on a field trip saves them after an accident, the kids and the local paper both honor him with seperate tributes. But unbeknownst to any of them, sweet, unassuming "Henry" is really a witness to a twenty year old murder. Now the gunmen and his thugs intend to tie up the last loose end which could undo them, and only Jaime can save the man who just saved her!

description: Jaime is looking after Susan Victor's wild animal ranch for a few days. Some of the local ranchers have become convinced Susan's pet lion Neil has been attacking their stock.
tags: ['man lion relationship', 'male african lion', 'pet lion', 'animal', 'lion', 'taking law into own hands', 'mistaken identity', 'african lion', 'bear', 'elephant', 'woman lion relationship', 'human animal relationship', 'girl lion relationship']
synopsis_with_character_names: Jaime and a neighbor girl are put in charge of a friend's menagerie of exotic pets -- including a lion local ranchers are convinced has been killing their livestock. It takes all Jaime's strength and powers of persuasion to keep "Neil" alive until his mistress returns to set the record straight.

description: An unauthorized missile has been launched from the ranch estate of tycoon J.T. Connors. Since J.T. used to sponsor Jaime Sommers during the early days of her tennis career, Oscar Goldman sends Jaime to investigate while Steve Austin monitors for more more missiles at M.E.W.S. Control.
synopsis_with_character_names: An old family friend stands accussed of blasting a missile at Los Angeles, and Jaime reluctantly agrees to investigate the man. But what she discovers imperrils her bionics, and now Jaime and the tough old goat who always used to look after her must trade places or another unauthorized weapon will get discharged -- straight at Steve and Oscar!!

description: Despite her objections, Oscar enters Jaime as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant which he thinks is being rigged. Posing as Miss California with Helen Elgin as her chaperon, Jaime is actually looking for a micro computer circuit that is about to be smuggled out of the country.
tags: ['close up of ear']
synopsis_with_character_names: Jaime must enter a beauty contest to keep a top secret thingamagiggie from being passed to the enemy.

description: Jaime is contacted by a mysterious woman claiming to be her mother. Oscar Goldman admits to the fact that Ann Sommers used to be a spy and even had a double by the name of Chris Stuart. While Jaime and Ann are getting reacquainted, some thugs on Ann's tail are planning to silence her once and for all.
tags: ['close up of ear', 'character name in episode title']
synopsis_with_character_names: When a woman who looks just like her long-dead mother appears out of the blue, Jaime's life is thrown into turmoil. A part of her knows this woman is an imposter, and when her bionic ear confirms this, Jaime must keep her wits about her if she is to save them both from the men who have decided mother and daughter must die.

description: Jaime becomes Tim Sander's navigator during the Dash-i-Ravar international race. Her goal is to secure a cassette tape with top secret information when the race passes through Taftan, South West Asia. In this part of the world, Oscar takes on a disguise and goes by the name of 'Oscar Bartholomew'.
synopsis_with_character_names: An important data tape has made its way to a dusty outpost in a Central Asian republic, and Jamie is sent to retrieve it -- under cover as a racecar driver, paired with the former world champion, who is desperate to make a comeback. Now she must convince the man to risk victory by taking a dangerous detour almost certain to lose them the race, and quite possibly get them killed, too -- the more so since anther team is also after the tape!

description: A native American boy joins Jaime's class at Ventura Air Force Base but has trouble fitting in because of his overactive imagination involving his Indian heritage. When he wanders into the desert to be on his own, he stumbles upon a test involving an atomic powered flying suit.
tags: ['close up of ear']
synopsis_with_character_names: A new student joins Jamie's class the same day a top secret personal flying suit is due to arrve on the base. This double assignmen seems simple enough, but the boy would rather visit his tribal burial grounds than stay in school Trouble is: that area is also being used by the very security team deputed to safeguard the suit -- to steal it!

description: Jaime is undercover as stewardess Miss Winters to keep an eye on Rudy Wells who is transporting a top secret Cobalt 247 formula. The plane goes down in an electrical storm and the passengers end up on a deserted island where the conspirators will do anything to get the formula from Rudy.
tags: ['character name in episode title']
synopsis_with_character_names: An old friend has entrusted the secret of a secret formula to Rudy Wells, who in turn puts himself in Jamie's hands in her undercover role as a stewardess on a flight across South America. But three assassins board the same plane, which then goes down on a deserted island. Now the bionic woman must protect her savior from both bullets and being lost at sea!

description: Jaime acts as a courier, delivering Dr. Hatcher's new Cryptograph analyzer. The next day, it turns out the device has fallen into the wrong hands and Jaime is accused of selling it to a foreign power.
tags: ['close up of ear', 'character name in episode title']
synopsis_with_character_names: When Jamie is entrusted with a $40 million decoder and asked to deliver it to a secret military base things go horribly wrong, but she doesn't know until she herself is implicated in the theft. Jamie is imprisoned, and must break out to learn the truth ad clear her name.

description: While Jaime Sommers is on vacation in Nassau, a surgeon named James Courtney transforms Lisa Galloway into Sommers' double using plastic surgery. Galloway infiltrates the OSI building to photograph top-secret documents and if needed, assassinate Oscar Goldman. Meanwhile, Courtney's henchmen are moving in on Jaime to get rid of her so Lisa can take her place permanentl... Read all
tags: ['female spy', 'evil double', 'drugged spy', 'attempted kidnapping', 'attempted murder', 'drugged drink', 'espionage', 'sabotage', 'spy camera', '1970s', 'bell bottoms', 'femme fatale', 'cold war', 'bikini']
synopsis_with_character_names: A dishonest doctor has made a female cohort look just like Jamie, and he sends her into the OSI to take Jamie's place while she's on holiday, tasking some friends with making sure the real bionic woman will never again be a problem. Escaping just in the nick of time, Jamie returns to Washington and switches roles with the double, who has been caught trying to assassinate Oscar, only to wriggle out of OSI custody! Now it's a mad dash to enemy headquarters and a comedy of errors as the two bionic woman lookalikes vie to come out on top, and neither side can figure out which is which.

description: Jamie poses as a governess to Amanda Cory who seems to be haunted by her mother's ghost. The supernatural disruptions are prohibiting Amanda's father to complete his OSI funded experiments.
tags: ['bad dream', 'begins with a dream', 'nightmare', 'begins with a nightmare', 'close up of ear']
synopsis_with_character_names: When strange events begin to interfere with an OSI scientist's(Paul Shenar) work on a new decoder, Jaime is assigned as governess to his daughter. Her real assignment is making sure that his work is uninterrupted, but this proves to be difficult due to the possible ghost of his first wife!

description: Billionaire playboy, Oliver Queen, has been considered dead for five years. Now, he has returned. But something, during those five years, has changed him into a mysterious green hooded archer.

synopsis_with_character_names:
Open with a bearded man being rescued from an island. Via voiceover we learn that he's been stranded here for five years and has transformed himself into something completely different during that time. His plan is to "bring justice to those who have poisoned my city." His name is Oliver Queen.

A news report tells us that Queen had been missing and presumed dead for five years. He is the son of billionaire Robert Queen, who was killed during the shipwreck. The younger Queen had been a notorious playboy before the accident.

Queen is reunited with mother Moira and brought back to his castle-like residence. He isn't too thrilled with seeing his father's former business partner Walter Steele, though he's overjoyed at the sight of his younger sister, Thea.

We see a young attorney named Laurel Lance working at a legal aide office. She is working on the case of Adam Hunt, a corporate financier who has swindled hundreds of people out of their homes. Laurel's sister, Sarah, was killed in Queen's shipwreck and she turns off the news report in the office.

The now incredibly muscular Queen says he doesn't recognize what he sees in the mirror. He flashes back to the shipwreck and we see that he was romantically involved with Sarah on the boat.

Queen's good buddy Tommy Merlyn comes over for dinner. Queen suggests wanting to spend time at the office and Walter doesn't seem to like the idea. It comes out that Walter and Moira are now married and Queen end up excusing himself from the table.

Queen sleeps with the window in his bedroom open. He dreams about the night of the wreck. Laurel's sister Sarah is worried about what their fooling around would do to her sister. The storm rips into the boat and knocks Sarah out to sea. Robert pulls him onto a life raft and tells him "she's gone." There is a storm and when Moira comes to check on him, he instinctively grabs her.

The next day, Queen visits Thea and gives her a Buddhist symbol of reconnection. Unbenknownst to him, she appears to be mixed up in drugs.

Tommy wants to organize a huge welcome home party for Queen. Queen says the person he missed the most while he was gone was Laurel.

Queen drops by Laurel's office. She's still very angry with him and ends up saying he should have died.

Queen and Tommy are kidnapped by mask-wearing men with guns. We flash back to Queen's father telling him on the life raft that he isn't the man he thinks he is. The kidnapper wants to know if Queen's father made it to the island and whether he told him anything. Queen is able to escape captivity and kill his attackers.

Queen is interviewed by Laurel's father, Detective Quentin Lance, and his partner, Lucas Hilton. They are skeptical of the claim that a man in a green hood saved them from the abductors. Lance comments on the Queens' wealth, offending Moira, but Walter smooths things over

Queen researches Hunt online. We see that Hunt's name appears on a list in a notebook he brought back with him from the island.

Moira wants Queen to have protection and assigns an ex-military man named John Diggle to be his bodyguard. Queen almost instantly gets away from Diggle and heads to one of his father's abandoned factories. He sets up a secret command post and begins training. His first target is Hunt.

Queen, now outfitted in his Arrow disguise, takes out several of Hunt's men and demands he transfer $40 million into a certain bank account by the following day. If Hunt doesn't comply, Arrow tells him he'll take the money "and you won't like how."

Hunt wants Lance and Hilton to make sure they find this "maniac" with the green hood. Neither are particularly interested in helping a suspected criminal, but Hunt tells them to coordinate with his head of security, Konstantin Drakon. Hilton concludes that Queen was telling the truth about the hooded vigiliante, Lance tells him that if the vigilante wants trouble, they'll give it to him.

It is the night of Queen's welcome home bash. The party is just across the street from the building where Hunt works. Queen spots his sister with drugs and they get into an argument. Queen literally runs into Laurel and the two of them speak privately. She apologizes for being so harsh with him and asks whether Sarah suffered. Queen tells Laurel he's not a better person than he was and warns her to stay away from him. It sounds like he's protecting her.

Queen gives Diggle the slip yet again. As Arrow, he heads next door and slices through Hunt's security team. He gets Hunt alone in his office and sends an arrow into a cabinet behind him. Arrow ends up getting into a lengthy fight with Drakon and ends up getting knocked to the ground. With Lance and Hilton on their way up the stairs, Arrow is out cold. But he wakes up just in time and leaps out the window, taking a zip line to the building where his party is being held.

Lance and Hilton arrive at the conference center and tell Queen the party is over. Queen tells them they are on private property, but offers a $2 million reward to anyone with information on Arrow. As the crowd cheers, Quentin and Hilton leave and Tommy comments that it's quite a coincidence that Arrow struck near the party. He asks Queen what happened to him on the island, and is told "a lot." We see Hunt yelling on the phone that $40 million has been removed from his accounts. The arrow that Queen shot into the wall had some kind of electronic device that tapped into his accounts.

Queen flashes back again to being on the raft with his father. Robert thinks his son is the only one who can survive and tells him to right his wrongs. Robert pulls out a gun and shoots the other man on the raft, then himself.

We see that the clients Laurel has been defending are being wired money that matches what they are owed by Hunt.

Tommy and Laurel go for a walk. They seems to have had an on-and-off romantic thing. Tommy would like to make it permanent, but Laurel doesn't think it can work.

In another voiceover we hear that Queen plans to get revenge on everybody on the list.

Moira meets with the apparent mastermind behind Queen's abduction. After being assured that there is no way the police can trace the kidnapping to her, Moira tells him that there are other ways to find out what Oliver knows about her husband's death.

description: Arrow moves further along his father's list while battling family issues with his mother, Moira, and especially with his sister. He also makes amends for past difficulties with Laurel.
tags: ['assassination attempt', 'lian yu', 'woman wears a red dress', 'three word title', 'drugs', 'getting drunk', 'drunk', 'rooftop fight', 'bar', 'party', 'rebellious daughter', 'underage drinking', 'nightclub', 'hug', 'crying', 'home invasion', 'hitwoman', 'female fighter', 'female warrior', 'female assassin', 'female killer', 'claw fight', 'claw', 'disarming someone', 'knife', 'ambush', 'pistol', 'machine gun', 'opening action scene', 'fistfight', 'gunfight', 'shootout', 'shot with an arrow', 'three word episode title', 'brawl', 'kiss', 'trial', 'escape', 'bare chested male', 'talking to a grave', 'stone grave', 'burying father', "visiting father's grave", 'hitlist', 'speech', 'ground breaking ceremony', 'chauffeured limousine', 'death threat', 'hanging upside down', 'climbing a rope']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Open with Oliver Queen/Arrow recapping some of the pilot in voice-over. Cut to Arrow beating up some guards and forcing a bad guy to make good.

Queen is to appear in court as part of legally coming back to life.

On his way into the courtroom Queen flashes back to the storm. He explains to the judge what happened, saying that for those five years on the island he felt he had to live for both he and his father. Queen's declaration of death is rescinded.

Queen runs into an angry Laurel outside the courtroom. Queen watches the press conference of a man being prosecuted by Laurel. Queen instantly gets free from his bodyguard Diggle.

We see Laurel give her opening statement against Martin Somers (Ty Olsson) who was smuggling drugs into the city by way of the Chinese Triads. In order to keep his illegal business going, Somers had a man named Victor killed. Laurel is arguing on behalf of Victor's daughter, Emily.

We learn that Somers' name was on his father's list. Cut to Arrow hanging Somers upside down, shooting arrows at him while demanding he confess to the murder.

Moira complains to Diggle about him continually losing her son. Queen walks in and she asks him where he runs off to when he escapes. Moira asks him to take Diggle with him on his next "rendezvous." Diggle tells Queen he'll quit if he's ditched one more time. Thea complains to Queen about him showing up after five years and judging her.

Somers doesn't want to tell Lance anything about his run-in with Arrow. Lance assures him he'll get his man and Somers makes a threat towards Laurel.

Queen gets a tour of the family business. Moira and Walter Steele (Colin Salmon) would like to name a new building after his father and ask him to take a leadership position in the company. Queen seems to have no interest in working for the company and makes a crack about Walter being married to his mother.

Diggle talks to Queen about family and this flashes Queen back to first landing on the island. His father's corpse washes up and he carries the body away from the birds.

Lance drops by Laurel's office and telling her she and Emily are getting 24/7 protective custody. She initially declines, but he says he's just doing his job.

Somers speaks with a female representative of the Triads. She seems to think killing Laurel would be a good idea.

Thea asks Queen about his scars. He says he's not ready to talk about what happened to him there. She takes him out back and shows him his tombstone. She says while he was gone she'd ask him for advice. But now that's he's back she feels less connected to him than she did when he was missing. She asks him to let her in.

Queen drops by Laurel's place. He says he initially blew her off to protect her, but now realizes that he hurt her. He tells her about not wanting to work for the company and his mother seeming not to accept his answer. She says her father blames himself more than he does Queen. Queen hears something and pulls her out just before somebody starts shooting. It's the Triads and Diggle saves the day just before Queen and Laurel are killed. The woman we saw meeting with Somers is also there, but she manages to escape. Lance arrives and thanks Diggle. He then tells Queen to stay away from his daughter.

Diggle noticed that Queen was able to help him by throwing an unbalanced kitchen knife ten feet across the room. Queen tries to brush it off as luck, but Diggle knows better.

Queen gets into his Arrow gear and prepared to go after Somers. Arrow arrives just as Somers is preparing to leave town.

Lance wants Laurel to recuse herself from the case. She won't do it. Lance gets a call about something happening at the docks.

Cut to Arrow fighting his way to Somers. He gets Somers to admit he ordered the Triads to kill Victor. A female member of the Triad, China White (Kelly Hu), shows up and a huge martial arts battle with Arrow ensues. The police show up and Lance has Arrow in his sights. But he shoots an arrow at Lance's arm, knocking the gun away but not harming him. Attached to the arrow is a digital recording of Somers' confession.

Queen decides he needs to be the person everybody thinks he is in order to fulfill his promise to his father.

Cut to Walter beginning the dedication. Queen shows up, seemingly drunk. He grabs the microphone and creates a scene. He says he's not half the man his father was and to "stop asking me to be."

Somers is headed to jail. Lance stops by to see Laurel. He's still not happy with Arrow, calling him an anarchist.

Queen crosses Somers' name off his father's list. He then flashes back to bringing his father's body to a rock. Inside his father's pocket his finds a blank journal with a circular logo on the front page.

Moira meets with somebody in the rear of a limousine, telling them that her son has no clue about what is actually going on or that the yacht was actually sabotaged. The person is holding something with the same circular logo.

Queen goes to his father's gravestone. He talks about how hard its been to reconnect and keep his secrets. He reaffirms his pledge to right his father's wrongs, but tells him that to do so he'll have to dishonor his memory. As he leaves, some workers move in to dismantle his headstone.

Back to the island flashback. As he is finishing burying his father under some rocks, Queen is hit in the right shoulder by an arrow. He looks back and sees a person wearing a hood, notching another arrow and preparing to fire at him again as he passed out.

description: A mysterious sniper called Deadshot is taking out bidders at an auction for an industry company. The bidders include Oliver's stepfather, Walter Steele.
tags: ['green arrow character', 'deadshot character', 'lian yu', 'two word title', 'sniper', 'auction', 'nightclub', 'fistfight', 'gunfight', 'shootout', 'two word episode title', 'brawl', 'swimming pool', 'party', 'poison', 'dancing', 'drinking', 'theft', 'night cityscape', 'crashing through a window', 'break door in', 'booby trap', 'caught in a net', 'self tattooing', 'poisoned bullet', 'curare', 'assassination']
synopsis_with_character_names:
While Queen trains, he explains through voiceover what Arrow is all about. His latest target is James Holder (Tobias Slezak), responsible for defective fire detectors in low-income housing. Arrow confronts Holder, but someone else is watching through a rifle scope. Before Arrow can finish his speech, the rifleman kills Holder and grazes Arrow with another shot.

Back in his lair Queen crosses Holder off his list, then falls to the ground, the result of a what he identifies as a poison bullet. He retrieves some herbs from his kit and ingests them as he passes out.

Flash back to Queen meeting the mysterious hooded man who shot him when he first arrived on the island. He tells him he shot him to protect him and then pulls out the arrow and disappears.

Queen gets to his feet.

A drunken Thea (Willa Holland) is brought home by police after stealing some things from a clothing store. Queen criticizes his mother for letting her stay home from school.

Lance wonders if Arrow might be behind Holder's shooting death.

Queen analyzes the poison, figuring out the shooter was a well-known assassin known as "Dead Shot." He doesn't like this guy because he doesn't kill for justice or honor. Dead Shot is now at the top of Queen's list.

Queen is planning to open up a new nightclub. Tommy wants them to check out the competition, a club named "Poison" owned by Max Fuller (Marcus Rosner), whose fiancé Queen happened to have slept with. Diggs points out that the new club Queen wants to open is in a rough part of town.

Joanna talks to Laurel about still having feelings for Queen. She wants them to go out that night to help Laurel move on.

Moira grounds Thea for two weeks.

Queen climbs the side of a building to pull something out of a wall.

The police gets back the ballistic report on Holder's murder. Lance still isn't sure and goes to get "my own evidence."

Queen determines the shooter was probably working on behalf of the Russian mob. He goes to a garage and asks, in Russian, for someone named Alexi Leonov (Barry Nerling). He shows a tattoo and says his name is "Bratva." He asks for information about Dead Shot.

A man named Karl Rasmussen is killed. Lance points out to Walter and Moira that Rasmussen was interested in purchasing a company they were also looking at. The auction for the sale is the following day.

Queen and Tommy drop by Poison, making sure to leave Diggle (David Ramsey) at the door. Laurel is there, as is a very drunk Thea. She spills the beans about Tommy and Laurel's romantic relationship and things get awkward. Fuller shows up and promptly punches Queen in the face. Tommy and Queen end up fighting his bodyguards, with Laurel coming to their rescue with some snappy moves of her own.

Another flashback to Queen on the island. He wakes up next to the man who shot him and runs outside. He quickly runs into a net.

At a restaurant the guys meet Diggle's sister-in-law Carly (Christie Laing). Tommy apologizes to Queen about not telling him about Laurel. Queen doesn't seem worried about it. We learn that Diggle's job somehow got his brother (Carly's husband) killed. Queen gets a call from the Russians, who give him an address for where Dead Shot stayed the last time he was in town.

We see Dead Shot looking at blueprints online.

Arrow arrives at the hotel room, leading to a fight with Dead Shot. Dead Shot jumps out the window and gets away.

Queen pays a visit to a woman named Felicity (Emily Bett Rickards) in his IT department. He gives her Dead Shot's damaged laptop in the hopes she can salvage some information.

Moira tells Thea a story about how good her father had been at getting through to her. This is first time he's come up in years.

Felicity finds the blueprints on Dead Shot's laptop. They are of the place where the auction for that company will be taking place. Queen realizes there are too many locations for Dead Shot to fire from. He'll need help.

Arrow grabs Lance and forcefully tells him what he knows about Dead Shot and his weapon of choice.

Thea joins her mother and Walter (Colin Salmon) at the auction. Lance has a large team protecting the area. But Dead Shot has already killed one of the officers and taken his post.

Tommy drops by Laurel's work to talk about the other night. She says she thinks it was obvious Queen already knew about them. Tommy says he wants to be the kind of man she'll want to be with.

Queen is at the auction. He mentions the potential for a shooting to Diggle. At the last minute Lance pushes Walter out of the way, preventing him from being killed.

Queen rushes up the stairs, grabbing his Arrow gear on the way. Diggle follows. Arrow and Dead Shot battle. Arrow eventually drops him with a shot through his right eye, but sees that Diggle has been hit.

We flashback to the island, as the mystery man releases Queen from the net with a warning about others on the island.

Arrow gives Diggle some of his organic antidote for the poison. Diggle struggles into consciousness and sees it was Oliver Queen, unmasked but in his Arrow leathers, who has saved him.

description: Peter Declan has been charged with murdering his wife, and only Oliver believes he's innocent. Arrow asks Laurel to look into Declan's case. Meanwhile, Walter investigates a warehouse that Moira mysteriously bought with the company's money.

synopsis_with_character_names:
We open with a little bit of the end of last week, as Arrow makes Diggs an antidote for the poison from Dead Shot. For some reason Diggs decides he should take a swing at Queen. Arrow explains he wants him to join his mission, saying his background as a soldier is perfect. Diggs doesn't seem interested and calls him a criminal and a murderer.

Queen comes home to Laurel waiting on him. She says his family doesn't deserve the selfishness of him keeping his family in the dark after he was shot at. Queen mentions to Laurel that she's the second friend to rip him a new one that night

Queen dreams about the island and trying to communicate with the arrow-wielding gentleman who appears to speak only Chinese. He wakes up and comes downstairs to find Thea watching TV show about a man named Declan who killed his wife a few years back. The two talk about Laurel and he tells her he's not the same guy he used to be.

The next morning Moira tells Queen that Diggs has resigned, telling her he didn't approve of "Queen's evenings." The new guy's name is Rob. Moira is also watching a report about Declan, who is set to be executed at midnight the following night. Queen sees that Declan's wife Camille had worked for a man named Brodeur. Queen quickly ditches Rob on his motorcycle.

At the Arrow hideout we see that Brodeur's name is on Queen's list.

Cut to Brodeur talking to an employee about the fact he had Camille killed because she was going to blow the whistle on his company's chemical dumping.

Queen is well aware that Brodeur was probably responsible for Camille's death, meaning an innocent man is about to die.

Queen pays Laurel a visit dressed as Arrow. He tells her about Camille wanting to blow the whistle on Brodeur and Declan being innocent.

Laurel meets with Declan. She goes through the evidence, which sounds damning. He swears that he's innocent.

Walter tells Moira that there is $2 million missing from the company. He thinks it is probably a bookkeeping error.

Laurel tells her father what she heard from Declan. Lance says that Camille's supervisor contradicted her story about going to him about the dumping.

Queen finds Diggs at the restaurant where his sister Carly works. Queen asks him once again to help him do the same kind of good he did in the military. To convince him, Queen shows him his father's journal. Queen tells him he needs to right the wrongs done by his family. He says he thinks the sniper he took out was his brother-in-law Andy's killer. If he helps him, Diggs will have the chance to help other people's families.

Moira tells Walter she thinks the missing money was invested in a friend's start-up a few years back. She'll talk to accounting and have it cleaned up. Walter doesn't look convinced.

Laurel tells Joanna who suggested she look into Declan.

Laurel meets with Arrow. She tells him about the supervisor, a man named Istook, contradicting Camille's story. Arrow tells her that Istook "hasn't been questioned by me." He says he's hiding his face to protect the people he cares about.

Walter asks IT wiz Felicity to discretely look into the disappeared $2.6 million.

Arrow pays Istook a visit. After chaining him to some train tracks Istook says he'll give him a file on Brodeur that will help Declan.

Another flashback to Queen on the island. He's hungry and the man hints that to eat he'll need to kill a bird.

Arrow drops off the file to Laurel. She says the city needs somebody like him.

Queen comes home and Thea points out he had a huge grin. He says it's because he's been showing his true self to Laurel.

Lance doesn't like the fact Laurel has been working with Arrow. She points out she wouldn't have to be breaking the law if the police had done their job correctly in the first place. He's not happy.

Laurel shows a judge the file and asks for a stay of the execution. The judge doesn't agree. Brodeur's lawyer Garrett comes in during the conversation and Laurel promises Brodeur she'll come after him.

Brodeur's associates point out to their boss that Laurel will be meeting with Declan at his prison. They have friends in the prison and hint that something bad will happen during the meeting.

Laurel tells Arrow about the problems she's having. Arrow says he'll get a confession.

Felicity tells Walter the money was used to set up an offshore LLC. It's completely off the books. A few years ago it purchased a warehouse in the city.

Diggs tells Carly he misses not making a difference.

Arrow tells Brodeur to confess. After Arrow shoots an arrow through Brodeur's hand his phone rings. Arrow learns what is about to happen to Declan.

During Laurel's meeting with Declan the lights are turned off and an alarm sounds. A virtual riot breaks out and during the confusion Laurel finds herself in the middle of a bunch of cons. Queen, dressed as a security guard, shows up in the nick of time to get her and Declan to safety. In the process he pounds on a con who tried to choke Laurel and she seems disturbed by his brutality.

Outside the prison Lance comes to see his daughter, telling her that Brodeur has confessed. Laurels says she now agrees with him about Arrow, that "he's a killer." She looked in his eyes and saw no remorse.

Flash back to a now-starving Queen on the island. He says he's never killed anything before. He grabs the bird and apologizes before breaking its neck.

Laurel tells Lance that the vigilante was wearing a guard uniform. This seems to give Lance an idea.

Walter pays a visit to the warehouse from Moira's LLC. The password "ROBERT" gets him inside. Inside he finds the wreckage of the Queen's Gambit, the boat Queen and his father were on.

Lance has the security footage from the Exchange building shooting examined more closely. He finds video of Queen changing into the Arrow outfit.

Queen crosses Brodeur off the list.

It turns out the man Queen is with does speak English. He says the only way he'll survive is if he's willing to kill more than the bird and he forgets about the picture of Laurel.

Moira meets with a man who shows him a picture of Arrow and says the vigilante is targeting "the list."

Diggs pays Queen a visit. He says Queen will need somebody to remind him who he really is. At this point, Lance breaks into the house with a team of officers and Queen is placed under arrest.

description: Laurel represents Oliver, when he is arrested by her father for murder. Subjugated to a polygraph test, Oliver recalls his struggles against Deathstroke on the island.
tags: ['reference to iron heights prison', 'lian yu', 'one word title', 'fistfight', 'gunfight', 'shootout', 'one word episode title', 'police shootout', 'brawl', 'kiss', 'torture', 'trial', 'contraband', 'beating', 'bare chested male']
synopsis_with_character_names:
5 YEARS AGO -- Oliver goes to pick up a rabbit Yao has killed and is grabbed by three armed men in masks and stuck in a cell in the ground.

In present day we see Oliver arrested. Through voiceover, he is confident that he has a way out of this mess.

Lance interrogates Oliver. Oliver assures him he's not a vigilante and has an excuse for being caught on video going into the bag with the hood. Moira and Walter show up and tells Lance the interrogation is over until their attorney arrives. Oliver wants Laurel to represent him.

Moira tells Laurel that Oliver has requested her and won't accept representation if it isn't her. Laurel doesn't think it's a good idea.

Oliver shows up at his arraignment without counsel. The judge advises against it. But once the subject of bail comes up Laurel enters the courtroom and helps him get home confinement. It's clear Laurel doesn't think Oliver could be Arrow.

Oliver has a tracking bracelet put on his ankle. He also wants to host a party at the house to prove he's okay with what's happening.

Laurel argues with her father over going after Oliver. He references Sarah and Laurel says Oliver isn't to blame.

Oliver tells Diggle that what happened with the video was intentional. Oliver tells Diggle about Leo Mueller, a German arms dealer who has arrived in town with military-grade hardware. He wants Diggle to track Mueller and figure out where the buy is happening.

Diggle has access to Oliver's Arrow hideout. He picks out some toys for his mission.

Walter meets with Josiah Hudson, the head of Oliver Consolidated's security, and tells him off the record that he has an assignment for him. He explains that he found the remains of Robert's yacht and wants Josiah to move them to a secure location. When Josiah wonders what's going on, Walter admits that he doesn't know yet.

The prosecutor tells Laurel and Oliver she'll consider a plea of insanity provided he agrees to spend time in an asylum. Oliver wants no part of it and says he'll take a polygraph in front of Lance. Oliver tells Laurel if he fails the polygraph he'll consider the deal.

Another flashback to the island: the mercenaries take Oliver to their commander, a man named Edward Fyers. Oliver tells him he'll be well compensated should he be rescued. Fyers shows Oliver a picture of Yao wearing a military uniform and asks if he knows him. Oliver lies and says no and Fyers picks up on it. Fyers summons his masked enforcer, and tells Oliver that he will suffer for not cooperating. Thea tells Oliver she's worried about how he's been acting since he returned from the island. He assures her isn't the Arrow person.

Moiras business associate, Malcolm, is concerned about the investigation into Oliver. Moira assures him that the charges against Oliver are false, but he suspects that Oliver is hiding something. During the polygraph Oliver flashes back to his interrogation on the island. He passes with flying colors and we see him being tortured by Deathstroke. Lance asks about his scars. Oliver said he wasn't alone on the island and admits to being tortured. Lance then asks if he's killed anyone: "Yes," is the answer, though he's talking about Sarah. Lance still isn't going to drop the charges.

During his party Oliver tells Diggle he wants him to dress up as Arrow and stop the arms deal. Diggle doesn't like the fact he was lied to but agrees to do it. Walter is told the Hudson was killed in a car accident.

Laurel apologizes to Oliver for how Lance acted. She tells him that after her sister died Lance threw himself into his work and her mother ended up leaving. She says she used to hate him, but is now starting to think about what happened to Oliver on the island. She wants to see the scars. He shows them to her and she is stunned. He says he survived because there was something he wanted more than death. They start to kiss but then Laurel pulls away and runs out.

Oliver flashes back to the island. Fyers begins to suspect that Oliver does not have the information he wants, and orders Deathstroke to kill him, but Yao breaks in and knocks Fyers out. Deathstroke attacks him, resulting in furious martial arts duel. The two seem to be evenly matched, but Yao manages to subdue Deathstroke long enough to escape with Oliver.

As Mueller cuts a deal with a street gang for his weapons, the lights in the warehouse go out. As Mueller and his men drive away with the weapons, Diggle takes on the gang members and knocks them out.

Walter tells Moira about finding the boat and the security chief dying. He's doesn't trust her. She doesn't want him to look into it any further.

Diggle calls Oliver to warn him that Mueller got away. While Oliver is on the phone, a man posing as a butler tries to kill him, and the tracking bracelet is broken in the ensuing scuffle. Lance comes in and shoots the attacker. Lance tells the family he's not sure who attacked Oliver. He then takes off the ankle monitor because the vigilante was spotted across town. Oliver thanks Lance.

Moira meets with Malcolm again. He was the one who went after Oliver, thinking he was the vigilante. He also had Hudson killed. Moira warns him that if he touches anybody in her family she'll take him down.

Another island flashback. Yao Fei takes Oliver back to the cave and admits that he's impressed that Oliver didn't break under torture. He reminds him to breathe, gives him the pouch, and heads out to hold off the mercs, sealing the cave mouth with an explosive before Oliver has a chance to follow.

Laurel brings Oliver the polygraph. It turns out there was a slight flutter on an answer she knows he lied about. Oliver says if she knew what happened to him on the island she would look at him differently. He tells her there's no way he could possibly aim a bow and arrow, as he's suffering from what happened to him on the island. She says nothing can ever happen between them and he agrees.

Oliver and Diggle talk about him lying to Laurel. Diggle doesn't think Oliver realizes the impact he's having on his family. Oliver says he thinks about it all the time.

Walter tells Moira he will be flying to Australia on an extended "business trip," he doesn't know how long he will be gone. Lance drowns his sorrows in a bar, and is picked up by Laurel after he has too much to drink. Oliver, back in his Arrow guise, corners Mueller and tells him he has failed his city.

description: Oliver's next target is Scott Morgan, a power executive who jacks up prices for electricity when people most need it. John Diggle suggests they go after the gang of bank robbers that recently wounded a police officer during a daytime heist. Oliver is not so keen but John isn't the kind of guy who gives up very easily. Oliver quickly identifies one of them as a high sc... Read all
