synopsis_with_character_names: Detective Lilly Rush investigates a case of a girl who was beaten to death on a tennis court during a party in 1976. This first "Cold Case" episode, set in 2003, finds Rush working on a triple murder when a fellow detective asks her to take an interview with a woman who reports a murder she witnessed over 25 years ago. Thus begins Detective Rush's career as the "go to" detective who solves cold cases in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. This storyline mirrors a true cold case in Greenwich, Connecticut with similar facts. In 2002, Michael Skakel was found guilty of murdering Martha Moxley, his brother's girlfriend in 1975. Similarities include the fact that he came from a prominent family; Skakel being a cousin of Robert Kennedy's children; Skakel hid in a tree, spied on his brother and his brother's girlfriend and then he killed her with a golfclub.

description: Lily re-investigates a 1980's murder where a young housewife was blown up by a bomb in her backyard. Meanwhile, the victim's now-grown daughter is bothering a pervert whom she believes is the killer, but is he?

synopsis_with_character_names: Detective Lilly is asked to investigate the murder of a fireman's first wife, who was going to testify against the man that exposed himself to her. One week before his trial, inside her detergent box of "Gleen" was planted a bomb that went off in her face. She was alive for 16 minutes after it went off and then died in their backyard. Found by her young duaghter also at home the scene is truly a heart-tugger. The fireman has since remarried and all seems like a perfect little family, a devoted husband to the community and revered as a hero at the firestation. But the daughter, set to marry is still very much haunted by the memories. Marvelous sets really recreates the time. This episode tugged a bit harder at the heart strings with a tight emotional script.

description: The team is searching for a suspected serial killer. The murders started with a young man who was hitchhiking home from the casino after winning $3000. They have little to go on other than a boot print.
synopsis_with_character_names:
The episode opens with the Delaware State Police sending a "teletype" request for Philly to check all recent cases, open or closed, that involve young male hitchhikers being shot in isolated woods off major roads. The squad members remember such a case which turned out to be that of Matt Mills. He was a very good-looking boy who had won $3000 gambling in Atlantic City, but missed his bus, was seen hitchhiking home, and then found shot execution-style in woods; the body positions and 38 caliber gun matching two other cases in NJ and DE. Other evidence available for the three cases included shoe prints, and a few fibers.

Looking into the records of the victim, he and a friend, Blaine Robbins, had tried to rob a convenience store in Philly a few years before his murder when they were juveniles. They had been caught by the Russian-immigrant owner who was angered that they were released with probation. The robbery plan had been to raise capital for a legitimate vending machine business planned by Blaine. After that, Matt reformed, stayed out of trouble, and got a good entry-level brokerage-firm job.

Looking into Matt's last day in Atlantic City, Blaine said that he met Matt there by accident but couldn't give him a ride home because he had no car.

Other evidence linked the three crimes to a truck driver whose route matched all three locations. Locating a long-time girlfriend who had originally met him while working as a whore at truck stops, she described violent sexually abusive behavior which could just as easily be directed to boys. Fibers from her carpet were consistent with but not unique enough to match the crime scenes. When bought in for questioning, he was arrogant and denied any connection, and agreed to take a lie-detector test, which was useless as he could lie on the control questions without detection. In his arrogance, he had put his feet on their table in front of the officers. Lilly noted that one shoe was worn in a distinctive clutch-pedal pattern, which turned out to match the other two cases but not Matt's. The Delaware police were very thankful for Lilly solving their case.

One of the squad members had formally been at the precinct where the convenience store robbery had occurred. Asking there, he found that the Russian had recently been reported shooting at other robbers. The Russian admitted it, and told from whom he had both got and later returned the gun after using it. But the gun had been sold again and was unavailable. After finding that the Russian's wife had won an Atlantic City excursion, the Russian admitted that he had lied about working at his store the day of the murder, and had in fact seen both boys in Atlantic City but that Blaine had driven off from the hotel before he met up with them. With further extremely intensive questioning by Scotty, the Russian then admitted that yes, he had killed Matt in the manner they said, but please don't hurt his family.

Although Scotty was proud of eliciting a confession, the captain who had been observing wasn't so sure, as it looked like the Russian would have confessed to anything at that point. He held off arresting the Russian and suggested another trip to New Jersey, as further investigation of Blaine's database records had found an employment address at a car-rental company.

The car-rental manager said that shortly after that time, he had turned over a gun, which turned out to be a 38, to his local police after confiscating it from Blaine and firing him for bringing it into work. They then looked at rental records and found that there was one car with unexplained mileage on it that Blaine could have used that day. With more inquiries, they found that Blaine had paid $3000 a few months after Matt's death for flying lessons in a scheme to make money in aerial advertising.

Finally, Blaine confessed, saying that they had been best friends but that Matt had ridiculed and ignored him. In the flashback, they met accidently in the casino, and discussed Blaine's tip from a casino worker about an IPO that needed an investment in a few days; Matt was not enthusiastic, and said he would check with analysts at his firm, and besides, where would they get capital? Then Blaine showed him a gun and told him his plan to rob the casino. Matt treated him like a child, and said he would warn the casino security if he acted like he was going to do anything like that. Later when Matt was hitchhiking, Blaine stops and says he wants to apologize and give him a ride home. After Matt gets in, the next thing we see is Blaine leading Matt at gunpoint into the woods.

In the follow up, Scotty is seen apologizing to the Russian and his family at their store.

(contributor lemoviecritic noted that a repeat air date 9/14/2008 which listed that title and storyline was not that episode, but another storyline of a college co-ed murdered and her lover/professor was suspected, she was not shot, but strangled and left in a wooded area.)

description: At the end of their vacation to Earth, one of three aliens decides to stay.
tags: ['snake', 'three word title', '20th century', 'friends who live together', 'character name in title']
synopsis_with_character_names:
DTZ, disguised as a rabbit, is eating when Brac, disguised as a rattlesnake, approaches. Startled, DTZ drops his food. Brac expresses disgust at DTZ's meal. They are interrupted by Bric, disguised as a gopher, who mentions looking forward to returning to Fleeblebrox. Brac and Bric transform back into their original alien forms, but DTZ refuses to leave Earth, expressing a desire to stay. Bric transforms a nearby log into a rocket ship. Brac forces DTZ into the ship, but DTZ escapes in a smaller pod, determined to remain on Earth.

Meanwhile, Dale is engrossed in an old alien movie, surrounded by empty walnut shells. Monterey Jack, Gadget, and Chip walk by, wondering where Monty's walnuts went. They see Dale goofing off and Chip, angrily, pulls the plug on the TV and tells Dale to replace the walnuts. Outside, DTZ's spaceship lands nearby. DTZ, sees Dale nearby collecting walnuts, panics and transforms the ship into a giant walnut. As Dale collects walnuts he notices the giant walnut and gets excited and tries to take the walnut but struggles due to its weight. He eventually moves it to the Rescue Rangers' headquarters.

Back at the Rescue Rangers Headquarters. Monty, Gadget, Zipper, and Chip are all in the kitchen as Monty begins to discuss his famous Walnut Wallroo recipe he learned during his travels. As Monty and the other talk Dale looks in to ensure they are not watching him as he moves to secure the giant walnut. Dale, now inside the main room of the tree house attempts to crack the walnut open but fails. Causing Dale to find an even bigger hammer. DTZ emerges, frazzled, and transforms as his body begins to inflate and turn into a chair as Dale returns with a larger hammer. Dale notices a button flashing from the walnut that has now revealed itself to be an alien spaceship. Dale goes and presses the button, releasing strange creatures that frighten him. He lands on DTZ, disguised as a chair, who knocks him off.

DTZ then emerges from his chair form to reveal his true form and attempts to recapture all the Erkburgles that Dale released from DTZ's spaceship. Dale, thrilled to see a real alien, tries to catch DTZ, who transforms by inflating himself again and turning into goo as DTZ tries to escape by going underneath the door through the cracks but is pulled back by Dale. They crash into the TV, dazed. DTZ tries to flee again, but Dale grabs his tail. DTZ yells at Dale to let go of his tail. DTZ transforms into a coiled spring, bouncing up and down with Dale holding on. As DTZ stretches and enlarges his spring form, Dale is pulled closer. A starburst effect signaling DTZ's transformation as DTZ transforms into a dragon. Dale now looking up at DTZ's new form continues to hold on to DTZ's tail as it grows thicker and larger, with spikes emerging and growing to match his new form. Dale's grip adjusts to the changing tail as DTZ completes his transformation.

DTZ, now towering over Dale, takes on the appearance of a dragon with a long, narrow face with a jagged mouth, two small curved horns on top of his head, and two frills resembling ear fins on the sides. He has large yellow eyes with black pupils and red crested spikes that run from the top of his head down his back, all the way to the tip of his tail. His long, flexible neck is covered with tan-colored banded scales that continue down to his plump belly. He has short, stout arms ending in four-fingered hands with claw-like digits, and large, thick thighs that support his feet, each with three sharp-toed claws. DTZ picks up Dale and lifts him up to his face as he begins to roar at Dale, who then excitedly asks if DTZ plans to take over the planet. DTZ, confused, explains he just wants to stay on Earth and have fun. Dale suggests DTZ become a Rescue Ranger. DTZ transforms into a copy of Dale but falls due to the size change.

Chip, hearing the commotion, mistakes DTZ for Dale and scolds him about the walnuts. DTZ, not understanding, irritates Chip further. Dale and DTZ gather walnuts, with DTZ using his powers to make the job more easier as well as make them float back to HQ. The other Rangers, cleaning the kitchen, are surprised by Dale's sudden productivity as Dale enters the rooms complete with a new batch of walnuts for Monty's recipe. Chip wanders about the HQ when he happens to come across Dale washing the Ranger Plane and is confounded by Dale's sudden personality change but quickly becomes confused by seeing Dale in two places, as Dale emerges with Monterrey Jack who tells Chip that everyone is going down to help Gadget move some equipment. Unsure what is happening Chip quickly tries to explain to Monty that he saw Dale cleaning the Ranger Plane but is humorously ignored by both Dale and Monty who think Chip is seeing things. Chip, shrugs it off.

Gadget, Monty, Zipper, Chip and a disguised DTZ all lift a typewriter gadget finds and attempts to carry it into a small elevator shaft. Monty asks Gadget if they can take a small break to which Gadget agrees to but forgets that she was also holding up the typewriter which causes the others to forcibly drop the typewriter on the ground due to the weight of the equipment. As the other Rangers take a quick water break Dale looks over in a hammock as he relaxes and eats grapes while he notices DTZ still near the typewriter. DTZ still disguised as Dale proceeds to use his alien power to make the typewriter lift itself up into the tree house. The other rangers returns from their water break when they notice that typewriter is now missing and ask Dale where the typewriter is. When DTZ answers back that the typewriter is now in the tree house Chip becomes confused and astounded that the disguised DTZ was able to do that all by himself.

Dale and DTZ perform more chores as Dale goes fishing, but DTZ, hearing his name called by Bric and Brac on the TV, panics and hides. The Rangers, unaware, of DTZ's presence stumble into the room. Monterrey tells the other Rescue Rangers that they have more cookies left over but the other rangers are now tired and sick of eating Monty's cookies as they begin to talk about how Dale has changed and how much they enjoy Dale's new personality change and hope that Dale stays like this forever. Dale returns and takes DTZ to his room, where Dale proceeds to list more chores for DTZ to do. DTZ then offers Dale a ride in his spaceship which excites Dale. DTZ then sends Dale to the mothership. Dale, thinking he's just going for a ride, ends up on the mothership. Where Dale encounters Bric and Brac for the first time as both Bric and Brac are unaware that this is not their DTZ.

Dale messes with the ship's controls, causing chaos. Bric and Brac, thinking Dale is DTZ, end up sending him away to his room but instead of Dale returning to DTZ's room he ends up finding more controls to mess with causing even more chaos and havoc for Bric and Brac. They then both try to feed him DTZ's favorite food, but Dale's disgust makes them think DTZ is becoming too much like an earthling. Bric proceeds to capture Dale by freezing him but instead misses and ends up hitting Brac instead as Dale is able to escapes back to Earth, returning to the Rangers' HQ. The Rangers watch a movie, trying to understand Dale's strange behavior. DTZ, trying to fit in, eventually sits with them.

As Dale makes land fall back on earth he rushes back to the HQ in order to warn everyone of the impostor. As the other rangers continue to watch the movie DTZ, disguised as Dale, begins to laugh uncontrollable at a scene in the movie which causes confusion among the other Rescue Rangers who are unsure why the disguised Dale finds the movie funny. Dale returns, and causes DTZ to panic until DTZ comes up with an idea and yells to the others about aliens, which causes a panic. Initially thinking the disguised Dale is making jokes the real Dale bursts in, which causes the other rangers to freak out and panic as both he and DTZ accuse each other of being the alien. As DTZ and Dale fight the other Rescue Rangers attempt to stop their fighting when they realize that there are two Dales.

When suddenly everyone in the HQ hears a loud rumbling sound as Zipper alerts everyone to a ship approaching the HQ. Bric and Brac disembarks from the mothership, demanding DTZ return or they will blow up the entire planet. DTZ leans overs to Dale to tell them that they are bluffing but when Gadget attempt to explain to both Bric and Brac that they will blow up to if they go through with their plan. Both Bric and Brac laugh at this remark as they demonstrate to her by blowing themselves up and reforming and letting everyone know that they are made of unstable molecules which means that they will not be harmed but the destruction of the planet. DTZ blushes knowing that he lied to Dale.

However Dale, remembering what DTZ's weakness is, uses DTZ's favorite food to lure him out. DTZ, revealing himself, is caught by Bric and Brac, who are happy to have him back. The Rangers, relieved to have their Dale back, share a laugh as DTZ happily eats his favorite food.

description: While trying to recover the Maltese Mouse, the Rangers baby sit two baby squirrels.
tags: ['three word title', '20th century', 'friends who live together']
synopsis_with_character_names:
The Rescue Rangers are in hot pursuit of Fat Cat, who has stolen the fabled Maltese Mouse. However, their chase causes the rangers to crash into the house of a squirrel family, a mother and her two daughters. Fat Cat quickly takes hold of the girls, and uses them as leverage to get the Maltese Mouse. The Rangers consent, and the girls are let free.

While the mother is at first thankful to the Rangers, her thanks turns to anger as she sees her house is now a wreck.

description: When a prissy Queen Bee finds her hive of workers have been stolen, she goes to the Rescue Rangers for help. Zipper is also eager to help, and develops a crush on the beautiful Queen Bee as well.
tags: ['two word title', '20th century', 'friends who live together']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A Queen Bee named Queenie is overseeing her hive of workers delivering nectar and making honey. However, a strange noise soon fills her ears and those of her workers. As Queenie watches, the entire hive of bees leaves and flies off.

Queenie soon after gives chase, but not used to such exertions, faints to the ground. Zipper soon comes across the Queen Bee, and is enchanted by her. When she asks if he can provide her with help, Zipper takes her to the Rescue Rangers.

Going through the city, they soon find the swarm of bees, breaking into a music store and making off with musical instruments, before hijacking a truck and carrying the instruments away.

The group finds the truck and instruments arriving at a pest control building, with the same noise that Queenie had heard before filling the air. The sound is generated by a machine created by Irwina Allen, a worker for the pest control company, who intends to mind-control the bees in a quest to become a rock and roll star.

The rangers attempt to turn off the machine, but Irwina sics the swarm on them and Queenie, who escape through a drain in the building.

As they ponder why Irwina would need musical instruments, Dale notes that the instruments resemble those from the heavy metal band, Iron Goose, who are planning to perform that evening.

The rangers then go to the venue, only to find Irwina having trapped the band in their dressing room. The rangers again attempt to stop Irwina, but she ends up trapping Zipper and Queenie in a saxophone, and putting the rest of the rangers in the drum set.

Irwina then takes to the stage, but her strange song and grating vocal turn-off the audience. However, while some of the bees are performing onstage, some are keeping the audience from leaving.

Zipper and Queenie manage to get free of the saxophone, and as Queenie looks on, Zipper makes a valiant attempt to stop Irwina, but not before she sics her bees on him. Zipper also manages to free the rangers, who manage to turn off Irwina's bee-control device, and put her out of commission. Queenie uses the opportunity to gain control over the swarm, and orders them to attack Irwina.

Once everything is safe, Queenie apologizes to Zipper for how she treated him, given how brave he was to try and help her. However, their moment is interrupted when the rest of the hive takes her away.

Zipper is depressed some time afterward, but soon is smiling when Queenie sends some of her bees to visit with a message from her.

description: The Thundercats must match wits with Safari Joe:the most successful big-game hunter in the galaxy.
tags: ['title spoken by character']
synopsis_with_character_names:
I love this episode safari joe, an big time game hunter who hunts thundercats. His holographic machine can tells all of the thundercats strengths and weaknesses. He captures wildkit and wildcat first putting them in thundrainium cells. Next he captures cheetara and tygra together, He fires rocket cuffs that is about to hit tygra, cheetara see the rocket cuffs pushing tygra out of the way. Cheetara gets hit attach themselves to her ankles and wrists and is helpless in the air nowhere to go.Tygra tell joe to free her joe tells tygra who you with your bolo-whip. Tygra than is tapped in a hole that fills with watch, tygra can't swin so he's defeated. Next we see cheetara and tygra in they cages weak as kittens, am guessing safari joe put tygra in this cage first than cheetara since she was in rocket cuffs. I never saw tygra look so bad as he did against safari joe, cheetara talks to joe saying why are you doing this and joe tell's she for sprots why else. Cheetara yells back and safari joe and joe tells her to take that back or i'll make your tiger friend into a rug. Tygra is so weak he don't even talk to safari joe. Next its panthro turn He's in the Tank, but Safari Joe manages to capsize it. Joe's next move is to capatalize on Panthro's fear of bats and shoots an energy bat to attack him. For whatever reason, this makes Panthro basically just pass out. Safari joe walks up to panthro kicks him and saids safari joe has done it again.Lion-O is back at the Lair and worried. But never fear, Jaga appears and explains what Safari Joe is up to. Empowered by the knowledge, Lion-O struts out of the Lair...only to fall into a hole. However, he's wise to Safari Joe's plan and manages to leap out without being shot. For whatever reason, Lion-O summons the 'Cats even though he knows they're imprisoned. Maybe he's contractually obligated to send up the signal once an episode, heh heh. When blackmailing Lion-O into surrendering didn't work, he strikes up a "deal" to get Lion-O to fight without the Sword. Lion-O agrees and throws the Sword aside, but leads Safari Joe into the Lair for the hunt. Lion-O almost succeeds in sneaking up on Safari Joe when he tumbles down along with a pile of boxes in the storage room. Lion-O is almost captured when Snarf sends a bucket sailing into the side of Joe's bald head. He drops his gun, causing it to shoot all its ammo. The bully was caught! The ThunderCats freed! the end, they let Safari Joe take off in his ship. But, they made him promise not to hunt anymore and changed Mule's work directive to make sure he adheres to the promise.

Things i didnot get how come tygra didnot turn invisble to fight against joe.
